8nJhbR62J-BomsiYWHh_QA.text: So-so food. Nothing exceptional. We had the trout and salmon, and both were just okay. The bread rolls were good, and the salad had a pretty good dressing. The soup was just decent. Nice ambiance and location, and the staff was friendly. They should spring for some nicer plates and bowls though!

Y5pWvLgaO58g2IWRhm3mIQ.text: Not sure why this isn't known as one of the best restaurants in Phoenix. We found this place through their excellent catering. We have eaten here three times and have had wonderful food and service each time. We highly recommend the halibut, either grilled, or as a special with tomato and Feta cheese on it if they have it. However, everything we've had has been excellent. The menu is not pretentious--just solid, delicious fare well prepared. It could use a little less salt sometimes, and I'm not a fan of as much garlic as Italian restaurants use, but the food is so good that I put up with the liberal use of garlic. Prices are very fair, wines are excellent, service is outstanding. It says something when the service staff (and probably the kitchen staff also) has so little turnover. They are professional and polished. Visit the bar three times, and they'll likely remember your name on the fourth visit. Michael is the consummate host. I want to go there for Happy Hour soon-it looks awesome and at great prices. Desserts are typical, and good, but not memorable. Try this place out. It's a gem.

Ip0OfpdAPNBMR38CyZOkFQ.text: Abridged: Good food, hotel restaurant feel.  I headed to Alexi's with friends for some good old carbs & veggies before a run on a Saturday night. When I arrived, I was a little worried as the over starched burgundy table decor and lack of patrons made me think of a stiff uncomfortable hotel restaurant.  Our server was friendly and knowledgeable, and the menu looked fantastic with so-so prices. I ended up getting the primavera dish and stayed with water for my drink. The food was great, even down to the bread. I devoured it with pleasure!   In the end though, I don't think the patrons or staff were amused with the out of ordinary conversations my friends and I often like to have. The food was good enough that I won't write it off my list, but I wouldn't be surprised if they didn't welcome my kind any more haha!!

bJL1X8hHqPO35aiyCTmTwQ.text: Alexi's patio is wonderful, and the happy hour appetizers make for great dinners.  One of our go-to places for an early meal.  Also, the staff is super-friendly, and our daughter is always welcome.

ONAkfHQEwWbZlNyLs0DeTA.text: Our party of four (with four different entrees) give Alexi's Twenty (20) Stars!  Rack of Lamb, Veal Chop, Pasta, and Chicken all great and despite a large private party and a full-restaurant served Impeccably.  These people know how to run a restaurant.

FMKW3An3IuHT7_K18syAbw.text: NOt a fan. Very strange place with mediochre food. The marsala sauce was thick and cold. The staff was not very friendly and the service was sub par. I will not be returning.

lFqsQ2YzxWcImst_EaaWxg.text: Blast from the past as far as their decor. I felt like I was walking into the 90's with the blonde wood dining tables and chairs, fake plants, wallpaper, etc. The food was very reasonably priced and good, which made up for the decor.  The service was very slow and left me wanting more attention. All in all, okay.

Q6WEe-2rqStuTzsUXvUCBA.text: My mom & I came here for dinner before the Michael Buble concert a couple weeks ago.   The white table cloths & bow-tie clad waiters made the place seem a bit stuffy. And it definitely felt like most of the diners there were 50+ (maybe they have a good senior citizen discount?).   For an appetizer we ordered the fried calamari. I thought it was pretty good, my mom thought it was too greasy & she might have been right. For dinner I ordered the grilled halibut, the halibut was very good (minus the tomato & cheese on top- I took them off). But the veggies that came with it, not so much. They gave me a lousy 3 wedges of red potato, a bland tasting piece of broccoli & way too sweet carrots. My mom ordered the grilled vegetable pasta. She thought it was too salty but I thought it was pretty tasty. The garlic & pesto sauce was so good! Oh & our meals came with a side salad, that only came with one option for dressing. Some creamy, lemon concoction that was not good, what ever happened to good old ranch?! For dessert we ordered the flan. It was pretty good but I've definitely had better.  It wasn't bad or anything but I really doubt we will come back. Maybe for happy hour but it's doubtful.

JkGSiSGuke-KiIWLhctjbw.text: Great lunch specials on Pasta every day about ~$7 (to go only).  The sauce is delicious and the food is very healthy. Add the salad or soup too if you're dining in.  Haven't tried their happy hour but will do that soon.

t_MnINIZgnO-I2bzBjN9UA.text: The food at Alexi's is good.  Lunch time chicken pitas were my favorite, and at night for the occasional dinner I'd get one of the fish entrees.  The atmosphere is a bit odd, but the servers are good natured and quick.  The only reservation I'd have is the odd treatment I sometimes got by the host(ess) when I did not have a reservation.  I was a regular at this place for a long time.  Occasionally though I'd forget to call ahead to reserve a table.  Even if the place was completely empty, without a reservation the host(ess) many times will become visibly annoyed and act as if it is a big deal to find you a table and then put you in a corner somewhere.  I don't know if everyone feels that way, or if it was only a way to try to condition me to call ahead next time since they knew my face.  Overall however, other than that, it is a decent place to go for the occasional grub.

BgjW7BR0b1xXBqs-WMWvSA.text: Outstanding service and for a lunch to introduce a new team member to phx , the food was superb.  Great fish and quiet table to have a quick lunch.

GBh4DVKtkO-bImPkq7enVg.text: Had a late lunch here earlier this month with a friend. We enjoyed siting on the patio. The bartender was a nice guy and attentive. We placed our order with him and later a server came on and took over and though he was a bit awkward and odd he provided nice enough service. I opt to have the Crispy Calimari as a starter. At first it wasn't very good at first -not crispy and too oily, but we sent it back to be cooked longer so that it was crispy and my lunch partner agreed that made it much better.  I had the Trout (farm-raised always a let down of sorts) Almondine ayet  I was very pleased with it! I would return again to have it.  My friend had the suggested Chicken Piccata dish that is popular there. It was okay, we could both tell that the chicken was prepared solo and the sauce added afterwards, then again we both cook and I have made this dish a number of times and know it well.  The side dish was a lame serving of a few (and I'm serious about a few) wedges of red potatoes like maybe 3 or 4 wedges and 2 crowns of broccoli!  Also we both had the house salad that was a nice mix of greens with the house dressing (you get no salad dressing choices!).  We had 2 glasses of wine each from the happy hour list and mine were very nice. Then we had the strawberry cheesecake. Huge slice! However lacking on the strawberries and enough sauce to properly dress the cake which alone had a wonderful texture but lacked flavor. Knowing this dessert is the one thing I would certainly change on a future visit.  The menu has a nice variety of options and the prices were within an acceptable range of $7 to $12 for this somewhat upscale lunch setting.

Zhz9JLX2pg26oa_9M7NGlg.text: The food is terrible. We went for happy hour and get the caprese and the calamari. The caprese was like eating diced tomatoes that had been stewing in something. The calamari was small and predominately breading.

-6CDThM1TpWMs0-OWfwS1A.text: Decided to try this place for lunch because it is right by my office. I sat at the bar. The bartender was really unfriendly; not a word, not a smile. He silently delivered my coke and took my order. I got a chicken ceasar salad. The food came out quickly. Salad was underdressed, chicken was well seasoned, but overcooked. By this time the bartender was nowhere to be found so I couldn't get a drink refill. When he finally came back, I asked for my check and he silently delivered. So, I was not impressed with the place. I would tolerate bad service for awesome food, but since neither was impressive, I won't be going back.

GcvRlSsIjSsa7a_efb2puw.text: I can't understand what happened with Patti's group???  I've been eating here for I don't even know how many years.  Originally opened by Christo (yeah, *that* Christo with the restaurant up on 7th St.), this is an absolute fav for a business lunch or dinner. or dinner on the way to the theater, ballet, symphony, etc.  Not unusual to see Gov. Napolitano, Mayor Gordon, business & civic leaders and somebody in jeans at the same time.  Great service!  Wonderful food!  You call it & I'm there!

DCuTgkE96G1g92tQfp9TbQ.text: Had a going away party for our Boss from St. Josephs Hospital. We decided to do the party here and it was Wonderful. Thomas was our server and he was great. Very quick to get our orders and let everyone do seperate checks. People were coming from 3 to 9 and he didnt slow down.  We had it outside on the patio and it was great. The food was outstanding. The prices for happy hour for food and drinks were great.  We do alot of baby showers etc and now we know our new spot.  Everyone was so happy and it was a great Retirement party. We will be back. Thank you!!!!!!!!!!!

gC_ng2pHYBVPvvYa8gWh9A.text: We loved the place. Great food and service. Great location as it us just minutes from the Phoenix Theatre.  We will be back!

uW3JUGeBtaw3RAtTVCrkFw.text: Just drove by, saw the sign and decided to stop. Had out of country friends and we are out of state as well.  Excellent service, great food, and very reasonable prices. Plus, the owner Michael Zistatsis came by and talked about the great state of Arizona, the wonderful things to see and do, and offered advice and help & directions. All of us were very surprised and pleased with the food and the experience. Highly recommend a visit. Tom from Pleasanton CA

T3P1wpLdZdOeQKkGQykWKA.text: I had the pleasure of attending a friends wedding last weekend that Alexi's Grill catered.  This was such a class act. The staff were so professional and Michael managed the event perfectly. You had the sense that everything was taken care of, no worries.  The presentation was fabulous, creative and fun.  You can see that this establishment and its owner take great pride in the quality of every aspect of the event.  Now to the food. OMG the appetizers were incredible. So fresh and full of flavor.  Dinner was exceptional. Hot like your mother just took it from the kitchen amazing mushroom sauce on the chicken, cooked perfectly. Oh and they prepared some food outside so the aroma was like you were in Florence. Seriously. The pasta was out of this world, vegetables cooked just to the point of a crunch. Bread, yum. And of course desert, I tried them all. Absolutely a 10. You can not go wrong with this caterer.  I have also enjoyed lunch and happy hour at the restaurant. It is such a class act.  Do not miss this gem. Quality all round and a complete pleasure of an evening.

9Oqf92J5TJemlj34XhzIlg.text: Alex'is is the perfect place to bring a client.  They serve dinner and lunch.  The nice atmosphere is conducive for conversation and eating.  There is massive lightrail construction going on in fornt of the restaurant though so getting in and out is not as easy as it used to be, but in soon time it will be back to normal.  Anyhow, Alexi's is a nice place. It has it's old Phoenix charm.  The owner, Michael is also the owner of Christo's.  Today, I had the filet minon and veggies, it was delicious!  Gov. Janet Napolitano is a fan! I hear she frequents the restuarant.

S4VBac7ZrvStamHEfxl8Bg.text: Charming restaurant with exceptional food. This was our first visit but definitely not our last. We came to celebrate the 75th birthday of my boyfriend's father who claimed this was the best birthday dinner he'd ever had.  Everything was prepared perfectly and the service was just as exceptional.   A hidden gem right in the heart of central Phoenix.

e758G5RiG-TIXJsPilipkA.text: This is my second time dining at Alexi's, so finally decided to write a review.  The decor is definitely old school...could use a little facelift, the service is excellent (best thing about the experience) and the food is just OK.  Each entree comes with either the house salad or a cup of soup.  I ordered the vodka tortellini, but was disappointed as the sauce was just alfredo...not the typical vodka sauce I am accustomed to.  I really enjoyed the orzo, chicken and vegetable soup of the night...quite tasty!  We have some friends that frequent Alexi's often and they seem to really enjoy it...just not our favorite place!

McDC9WMCsHe8Tc8QJkxvQw.text: Michael was a great host We ordered to go and he double checked everything to make sure it was all there and hot Food was excellent and not overpriced

MexFibd_TcND99LvEP2ptw.text: I can't believe I haven't been here before. The food is incredible with amazingly reasonable prices. They have the best 3-7 happy hour in town, hands down. Best lamb in the city- this is coming from a non-lamb fan too. I will be here again really soon.

CFSj4A6tPcP-yjqUOzHIHg.text: The happy hour is reasonably priced and the food is great. We ordered almost the entire happy hour menu and were not disappointed. Loved the pulled pork pita bites. The service was great, professional, and all around a good experience. We will be back!

1k4jQYzniBi5NHsjMTxQow.text: Went to my first Happy Hour last night at Alexi's. It is a decade since I last dined there. The menu selection and pricing is great.  Our server, Steve was amazing.  There was a group of us with constant demands for food, wine and water and he never missed a beat.  This is one of the very best Happy Hours in the Valley and I cannot wait to return.  Thank you!  :)

rOWyGxQWM-4PxGv9sYLhYQ.text: Alexi's Grill can't be beat.  The food is consistently good - especially the Halibut Athena - halibut topped with tomatoes and feta cheese in a light lemon butter sauce (not on the menu, but usually a special), Salmon Genovese, Capellini Pomodoro, and all of their soups.  And as an appletini connoisseur, I can tell you that Alexi's is the best I've had anywhere!  The waiters are professional but friendly and fun, and after you've been there a few times, don't be surprised if they have your favorite drink on the table as soon as you walk in!

plbo4tEfxSyH8oSQBvIiDw.text: I called Alexi's and asked them to accomodate a party of 16 (with split checks on a Friday night!!!) with just an hour of notice and they went above and beyond! The food was delicious and very fresh, the service was superb. I'm so grateful and pleased. Thank you for a wonderful meal!

gBEYgNCiQ2k9auaeq7j2rA.text: When I first pulled up, I couldn't really see where the restaurant was but once I was inside, I was impressed!! We were celebrating my mom's birthday and everything was amazing, the service, the ambiance, and the immaculate dishes. The waiter was patient yet delightful. I recommend this place to anyone who wants to have a great dining experience

J6lt7S1bVS4C6zSoe35zCQ.text: My husband and I came into town for business and leisure. Alexi's was our first stop for dinner. We had the salmon and halibut, which was perfectly cooked!  Despite how busy the restaurant was, the owner came by to greet us and see how we were doing. Overall, the entire staff provided personal legendary service. How many places can you say provides amazing food, and service?

4g3Ej8aC1EeX-u_VIj_fBA.text: Alexi's is a Phoenix classic. Great food, great service, but old menu.   You can always count on Alexi's for a good meal, of epic proportions that will be very filling.

RzjAdFnvWKaEl-yEqsFwIA.text: I only gave 2 stars. The hostess tonight was a total b.tch. She needs to learn to have better customer service skills. Don't shush your customers. The waitress was ok. The food was ok. The drinks were weak. We won't be back.

ND0iNVDeqMRJ8gtRpGikVw.text: I have to say that I have been to Alexi's Grill on several occasions through  the years. It always reminds me of what it must've been like in the days of the  'rat pack'. It just has that kind of  'feel' to the restaurant. There's always people at the bar.  It's not far from my home and the food is pretty good. I loved that in previous visits, they went out of their way to accommodate your request. I love grilled veggies, so they used to grill veggies at my request, but that was a few years ago. I looked forward to going there because they were kind but, now, although they weren't rude I will not return. I ordered take out today after looking at the menu (in all fairness it was on Grubhub). The price, I thought, was decent....until I got the bill. The menu was several dollars less PER ITEM than what they charged me. When I brought it to their attention the  'hostess' (she may have been new as she didn't seem very knowledgeable about how to treat customers), said to me that she'd "tell the manager so no one else gets confused." She didn't offer an explanation, certainly didn't offer to match the online price and just dismissed me as if it didn't matter there was such a discrepancy. I'm not sure what happened but the food wasn't as described and I've never had mushrooms on my chicken piccata. It wasn't as good as it used to be. The Melanzane Alexi (also more expensive than what the menu says) was not visually appealing and didn't taste at all as I expected it to taste. I threw it away. The eggplant was pale and looked as if was old. I did ask for a side of grilled zucchini, but the waitress said that it was already cut and they couldn't give it to me. Previously when I asked about grilling veggies, I was told that they'd happily grill veggies for me, although that was a year or two ago. Yes, I've been going to Alexi' for several years. It's sad, I will not return. It would've been different if they would have at least faked concern about what was happening.

u4f_F04T29Ts5zbvkmj13Q.text: Alexi's is one of my fave restaurants here in Phoenix.  And their very best item is not always advertised or on the menu.  They have the best duck a l'orange ever.  Ya gotta try it!  Tender and incredibly flavorful....heaven in one bite!

hm5rjE4QOHyE7PV1bD0UeA.text: I  am impressed. I wish we had visited this place sooner as we work less than a mile away.  Service was great and I was pleasantly surprised with the food.  We all ordered a different variety of dishes and the all looked good.  Will definitely be back for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Alexi's Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled chicken pita

yjLI4wpFDmmcAGEzpaKhfw.text: Love this place. I used to go here all the time when I worked at Dignity Health, and it's great to be back in the neighborhood (my office at least) to enjoy their food. Atmosphere is business dress - most men have collared shirts, suits or slacks and nice shoes. Tables have white tablecloths. Having said that it is not pricey -- the lunch menu is very affordable and a great place for a business lunch. Highly recommended if you are in the St Joseph's hospital area along central and looking for a nice lunch spot for a business meeting.

photos.caption: Photo of Alexi's Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Alexi's Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bar

g5k2Ja1Lsr0F-hyR4GQMrg.text: Alexi's is a long time staple for my family. Recently, they scrambled on very short notice to help us put together a lovely funeral reception. Michael went way above and beyond to accommodate our family.  When all of our guests showed up, they enjoyed fantastic food, wine, and hospitality.  When you are considering great places in uptown, Alexi's has to be on the top of your list.

0np-X0TDU_snRgYhWQlQqQ.text: So I've passed this place many times...always wanting to dine there. This trip I did. The place was very busy, which is a good sign. I found a spot at the bar and had a great dinner....Italian Bean soup to start then capellini which tomatoes and garlic. It was very good. Bartender was great as was the entire staff.

Yogg23hgCA-_aMMuyjBVkQ.text: Alexi's  is one those places that always keeps you coming back for the great service that they provide! The food is incredible, there's always favor .The atmosphere is so cozy, it's great for a date night and it's that great for a casual night. No matter what you are in thee mood, they deliver every time. Michael the owner always makes you feel welcomed!  Thomas is the best at the craft of service.  Thank you for giving us a great place to keep coming back too.

photos.caption: Photo of Alexi's Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yum!

AD64qLyO1NZm2M6lk2cb0Q.text: Great spot here is my experience from dinner. As you walk in you pass by a small herb garden so you smell the fresh herbs as you come to the front door.  With those smells already in my nose I was ready to eat before we even opened the door. The hostess greeted us and saw us to our seats right away. The server showed up seconds after offering drinks and menus. I chose the Halibut my wife had the Salmon and our toddler had Alfredo. I tried a bite of everything and I must say it was AMAZING. Highly recommended for a casual dinner or a date night out. The atmosphere suits both.  Will go there again.

photos.caption: Photo of Alexi's Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Green salad, fresh and light.
Photo of Alexi's Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Halibut Athena with fresh veggies.

EvYTgE23wxipO619doGUMQ.text: Happy hour there is the best value both regarding offerings and the bar service!  Dinner is also a treat as every bite was delicious from the lemon rice soup to the lamb and beyond. The halibut was by far the favorite from two of our guests who joined us on our 3rd visit since January. My partner also wanted me to note that "The vodka tortellini, is to die for".. Ciao K

MNeP_IY3UD-eDdvOe7zC5A.text: Exquisite & Savory! Is the only way to describe the food. We had the pleasure and honor of having Alexi's cater our daughters Quinceanera for cocktail hour and dinner. Michael was truly the best we love and adore him for helping in such a big event. We had called about 2-3 other caterers which in our case was disastrous. Some were hard to even get a hold of, they would ask what we wanted and literally threw a number at us or whenever speaking to them they seemed preoccupied. When speaking to Michael he was always attentive and friendly, he asked to meet us in person to discuss in detail what we wanted and to give any menu suggestions as needed which was great. Michael also went over all the ingredients that would be used and different options if desired. We did a tasting of the food that would be served which was phenomenal!! The food was fresh and savory, the day of our event every one raved about how great the food was. Alexi's is definitely a must try restaurant, I highly recommend the meatballs they are delicious!!!

cS6K9prnuoOu-q_8fnAMiA.text: 4 Stars, are you kidding me??? Anybody see the Kelsey Grammer submarine movie Down Periscope?  The Caesar dressing had to come out of a can that was 30 years old.  My wife identified that they microwaved the rolls.  How do we know?  The longer they sat the harder they got.  By the time I got to my chicken parm, with the precooked chicken, and sliced cheese, barely melted, my stomach was already too disgusted to take more than a couple bites.  The food at my parents assisted care facility clearly gives them a run for their money.

d4DE9xM_xUoQ3bA-vHPW7g.text: My friend and I met here, prior to going to a Suns game, ON A TUESDAY NIGHT.  We wanted a restaurant close to the Light  Rail.  We were the first ones seated in the restaurant.  I ordered the chicken picada and my friend being vegetarian, ordered a salad.  They brought the bread and butter, I thought the bread was a little tasteless and I love bread. We waited and waited.  I finally asked where was our food, oh it should be ready (tells you something).  I went to the restroom and our food was on the table when I came back, I looked at mine and it had something red on the top, I finally was able to flag our waiter and said this doesn't taste like picada and he said it's not, mix up in the kitchen, took the plate and brought  my picada and by now it was cold.    My friend said someone (not our waiter) brought my plate and then came back and took it away and brought the dish with the red (assuming it was sundried tomatoes).  Yes, I would say that was a mix up, but it was not the kitchen's fault.  It was the waiter's.  I had asked for extra sauce and bread to dip in the sauce, got neither one.  He had a party of six come in and after that he practically ignored us. I am a fairly good cook, I go to a nice restaurant for the service as well as the food. This was NOT good service, in fact it was terrible  We'll eat at the game next time.  As for the food, again the bread was tasteless, the vegetables were almost raw (not that I like mine over cooked, but i could not cut them with my knife) the picada was okay, but mine is better.  Don't think we will be back!

imXQzprU8fDJn2ehzv0Bmg.text: I am from Washington and every time we come to Arizona we have to eat here! Food is absolutely divine!! The atmosphere here is fantastic white table clothes and candles through out the whole establishment. The staff is very well-dressed in blacks and whites which I very appreciated. Till next time guys can't wait to come back!!

y-l-xWsh00dYMzWz71DB3Q.text: We LOVED this place and can think of no complaints. It was out of the way of the busy scene, and we didn't have to wait on a Saturday night around 7pm at all. The wait staff was ready at all times to serve us. The owner(?) came by and told us stories about Phoenix since we were visiting. He even pulled up a YouTube video to show us a monsoon he was describing. They served us so well (boxing up our food, refilling our water, refolding our napkins, etc). They even gave us a complimentary dessert!!! We felt like royalty. The food was also delicious. I ordered Vegetable Pasta and the amount of vegetables was unprecedented. We also had the Fettuccine Alfredo and it tasted so so smooth. I think there was a block of butter in there, but I'm not complaining. You should definitely go here if you are in Phoenix and want some fabulous Italian!! We wish we could go again tomorrow!!

photos.caption: Photo of Alexi's Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quiet and romantic
Photo of Alexi's Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegetable Pasta with basil sauce! SOOO delicious.

UxoAQ9myoIJqEpH5Ai4sZA.text: Food was horrible over salted servers nasty once a good restersunt everything to salty.....not worth paying for don't go

5dA61rpYi-nAAxwvnaPtZw.text: I thought this place was great! My boyfriend and I went here for Valentine's Day & had a great meal. We had a nice house wine, I ordered the chicken bolognese, and he had the roast duck. All the food was amazing, even the bread and salad was phenomenal.   The only thing was that as tasty as my boyfriend's duck was, it had a nasty hair in it. The restaurant replaced his meal, but I feel that more could have been done besides simply saying "it happens".

photos.caption: Photo of Alexi's Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Duck roast
Photo of Alexi's Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken bolognese

61DcEbuxhs9GW1PZRd0HGA.text: Our waiter was attentive and humorous, and the place has a classy atmosphere.  I had the trout almondine, and it was delicious.  My friend had the chicken piccata and enjoyed that as well.  Prices were reasonable for the value.

PIMQKZJWNJBSDxTE2IwseQ.text: Actually, my first time in there during their happy hour was not bad at all. The food was good, as well as the service. But during my second visit with a total of 7 of us, the waiter (a guy) was rolling his eyes (probably thinking that we were not supposed to show up without first studying their menu) and telling us that he only has 2 arms (and we really thought some waiters have more than that - thank you for letting us know). My orzo soup definitely came from a can of Campbell's tomato soup, the salmon was ok, it tasted as if it was warmed up in a microwave. So, I guess it is somewhat ok if you are not picky.

JBumsbKPqcGQKU0_-bnmRw.text: My boyfriend and I came here for Valentine's Day and had the best experience. I ordered the Lobster Ravioli and my boyfriend had the Garlic Scampi and both were perfect. The soup and salad were also delicious. The couple next to us picked up our bill and bought us dessert and orchestrated the whole thing in secret with our serve. if they ever see this I hope they know we were very appreciative.. The service was excellent and the waiter was extremely helpful. We're already talking about making birthday plans at Alexi's.

OkkuKHMAVuyFj62oGtu4qQ.text: We are on vacation staying at a hotel not too far from here, we looked on yelp for a place close by to eat and came across Alexi's Grill!!! I gave them 5 stars not only for the food which was so satisfying but, for the great customer service from beginning to end. We were unaware that there was a dress code but instead of making a huge deal about it they just nicely offered us to sit at the bar which was totally fine because that's where we wanted to sit any way lol. Our server/bartender was so polite and hospitable great job Sr!!! Thank you guys for a great experience no wonder you've been open 25 years! Keep up the great work and we will see you again for sure next time we are in AZ!!!

gTNB-5ZqxXLPXQ1AW3-6IQ.text: - top shelf quality at bottom shelf prices -  Came in here on a business lunch and was amazed at the professional atmosphere .  Next it was the prices, all under $15 for lunch. This included top options.  Location is great and parking is plentiful.  Will be back and would recommend it

80ciQousyOocq5gr9uq60w.text: Enjoyed lunch here with my son and a long time friend who had business in the area after our gathering.  I searched out a place nearby and the Alexis Grill was a logical choice based on its location and other Yelp reviews.  The three of us each ordered different seafood specials of the day which is not typical for me. Mine was grilled halibut with goat cheese topping that was quite good.  My son had shrimp and shellfish over pasta which he really liked while my old pal tried the salmon special.  Everything was made to order and served quickly.  We arrived early for lunch (11:45am) and by the time we finished the dining room was pretty full with business men and women which I believe is an at testament to its popularity.

4EXjWGKyly1ZXi9y9nih9w.text: We had a wonderful dinner at Alexi last week.  The service was great.  Every dish we had was wonderful.  The beef steaks were tender and perfectly prepared.  The rack of lamb is one of the best I have ever had. And the carrots.........for a simple side dish I couldn't have asked for better!  (I would love the recipe for these carrots!) Parking was no problem.  All of the wait staff were very courteous.  We will go there again next time we are staying in downtown Phoenix.

HuMMmSana0H0TRC1pIBpdw.text: We went there for a "girls late birthday lunch". It was not very crowded. The food was very good. However, because the place was not very crowded, we expected better service. We could see the waiter, talking with others in back of restaurant. We had to wave at him for more water.We did sit there for a long time because it was an occasion for us. Since it was not crowded, we felt we were not taking up a table for anyone else. The waiter came to check on us right after our meals were served, but that was it until we waved at him for more water. We did expect great customer service since we have always had it there in the past....................not this time

LUIG8tcPMr3TXI_IovGAtQ.text: Food:  Had the eggplant appetizer which went from bland to amazing with the addition of a small amount of salt.  Had the special Athenian Halibut which I cannot say enough good things about; it was exquisite.  I would have been happy with more of it!  The portion size was fine for most people but I'm one of those "more is better" people when it comes to food.  The hostess was a delight and the wait staff was I guess what you'd expect from fine dining but I like to laugh and joke with them and there was none of that.  Of course, I didn't go for the social experience, I went for the food, which, as I said, was outstanding.

YicRoGcuKuEDLqqkkPv1rw.text: I stayed at the Wyndham, a 2-minute walk from this restaurant. Arrived just after 7, and it appeared to be winding down from the dinner rush.  Rather than wait for the staff to clear a table, I took a seat at the bar.  The bar has approximately 10 seats. When the bartender finally acknowledged me, I ordered the house Chianti, which was fine, but I wasn't offered a menu.  I sat at the bar for 20 minutes waiting to be asked how the wine was, if I wanted an appetizer or to be offered a menu.   You only get one chance at a first impression, and this place failed.

mXCnQae2ZNi-fWzBP6pSzQ.text: This restaurant is phenomenal! I'm vegan and ordered the Capellini Pomodoro. Our waiter was so attentive and made sure the sauce had no butter or cheese in it. For my salad, he kindly warned me of the qsddxdaacca quip cheese in the housing dressing and swapped it out for the balsamic dressing instead. He also double checked to make sure my diet wasn't due to any allergies, which very few restaurants actually do. My pasta was DELICOUS and filling with nothing left to be missed. I would recommend this place in a heartbeat to anyone craving pasta, fish, or a meal with an italian flare.

e_UtzZGL81R-ONKR4lyqdw.text: The food was great. Our waiter was outstanding. Price was very good. You can't beat it. Definitely the place to eat in Phoenix.

CcBzN-DT_bdSjVVF9XBNcQ.text: A little bit pricey, but expected for this nice restaurant. I have only eaten to-go or stopped by for a drink as I attend a class in the same building, but the food was phenomenal and the staff was very friendly. This is definitely a date-night spot for me.

p36x9IqVIPGDfPNao_WifA.text: Three stars at most.  Service was not just sloppy, but I found insulting. I asked to see a wine list when asked if I'd like wine, and the waiter proceeds to insist that I just tell him what type of wine I want then he will tell me what they have. So, I said no, I want to SEE the wine list. Well, not much to see.  And the one I did want from the extremely short list, they were out of.  Please.    The "bread" service comes and it is a basket of the worst breadsticks (hard and inedible even with butter which I had to steal a knife from a neighboring table to attempt to spread on the roll).  My caprese was only adequate... Tomatoes underripe and only olive oil as an addition with some sliced basil. I did like the table top salt and pepper grinders which made up for some flavor (perhaps add the option of a balsamic glaze?).   Thank goodness the main entree of California Halibut was edible and almost as enjoyable as the glazed carrots and potatoes on the plate...all floating in grease, but still tasty.  Staff at the Hampton Inn pushed this place. Should

EgX8i3b9QNdZtvX7dkAdeg.text: Great place! Ate here after going to the Phoenix theater. Food responsible and delicious. Paul our waiter was attentive and knowledgeable. Don't miss this place

p1lZIPnv7gwgxU_UI2oyyg.text: I usually give 4 STARS to all restaurants; but had some challenges: Here are the positives: The special fish dish (cod); it was excellent; moist and very tasty. The trout was something I would order; even though I don't like trout. The carrots and the soup was great. Now the negatives:  Getting stuck in the "cubby" hole table. Hostess not letting the waiter know, that he had another table; so had to wait for menus and service. Kept adjusting lights; up & down, up & down - how long have you been in business??? Water glasses; ended up completely dry - before I could "flag" another waiter down; only having him "yell" to the our waiter; that we needed water. Chef came out to greet other guests/table; but not ours. If you are a regular guest; you get good service. Won't be a regular guest; I guess.

PyrVS1DKBbuBo6jdWBPwMw.text: This is nice establishment for good Italian food. Their chicken marsala tastes fresh and is well made, and the Chicken Alfredo is good as well. Be sure to make reservations as it can get a bit busy some nights.

bBTXQpy6Nuc20_WwNJz8bw.text: Over the past seven years, we (Wife and I) have dined here, about 6 times.  We had just left the Theatre ... saw a wonderful Sherlock Holmes play. ****Arrived at Alexi's, at 4:45pm, on Saturday 22nd. ****Restaurant is empty, with the exception of three tables. ****Hostess, is insistent on seating us , in "cubby holes" or corners. ****Told Her .... NO. ****We'll dine elsewhere if necessary. ****Finally, we were offered a "proper" table.    As other Diners, were arriving, she's playing the same "cubby hole" game, with them. TSK ...TSK ...Where is the ownership ????? Then again, it appeared, she was "following orders"!                                   Now For The Food On this visit, and ALL past visits, I always have  the Chicken Marsala Southwest. My wife, on this and past visits, always has the Chicken Piccata. *****Both were over cooked. *****Both were BLAND. *****Both were not the entrees, we had come to expect at Alexi's.                                     Bread and Salad *****The dinner rolls were tasteless....Thank Goodness for the Butter and salt on the table. *****The House dressing on the salad was ICK (my wife) ...and YUK (me).  Alexi's, Thank You .... for the past dinning experiences. As for the Future .... WE WILL NEVER RETURN, on our "dime".

GFUUAIN18YsOLRGnUyq-Zg.text: I absolutely love this place. Came here with a small group of friends last night. The owner, Mike, was most gracious and took excellent care of us. The food and ambience were both superb. I highly recommend this restaurant!

uR597_h3mocNeS9Bcl_zbw.text: The lunch menu is amazing and affordable and goes to 4pm. The happy hours is from 3 to 7 and are excellent at a very good price.   The service is friendly and fast.   Will go back for sure.

WoW83Y2jEBIfcH0Bf62KjA.text: This is a must do restaurant in Central Phoenix.  I have been several times and had the Chicken Picatta, Chicken Marsala Southwest and Fettucine Alfredo and they are all delicious.  Service and staff are very attentive without being intruding. They also have a wonderful Happy Hour with great appetizers and drink specials.

fkEG9HL2RDwX9Ke_FUlcHQ.text: Please keep in mind I was raised in Las Vegas were we are spoiled on both service and food. This is one of the first establishments I decided to try in my new town (relocation for work) the bar tender J.was fantastic he handled many orders from the table servers while staying very attentive to my needs making sure I got one more drink in before happy hours ended (which I didn't even know was in effect) a traditional Italian cuisine I spotted something I wanted Immediately and after ordering (which was prompt due to Jims observant eye) the soup portion was put within 2 min which is fast by any ones standards. The soup was well made and perfectly proportioned for a before dinner soup...I ordered the smoked salmon alfredo  which came out so fast it made me sceptical of the quality. But alas the salmon was very good and infused through the the whole meal though I will say it was a little sparse...the food was wonderful and as a rally give a 5 star this hits a solid 4 with price being fare the service being amazing and the food excellent. Do not hesitate to give this establishment a try at your first chance.

8LIQKnRoixOU5eCuVHR3SQ.text: Our team was in town for a project, so accommodating 12 for a last-minute seating can prove to be a bit challenging. The staff at Alexi's was friendly, and our waiter (I think his name is Thomas) was fantastic. His care and attention, plus friendly demeanor added so much to our dining experience. Our meals were delicious and the atmosphere allowed for conversations to be had without yelling to be heard. Would definitely recommend them to anyone looking for a good Italian meal.

oU6aWu2IisoEYaijyF5Mfg.text: This review can not comment on the food at Alexi's because frankly we left.  We patiently waited for over 10 minutes for a waiter to ask us about drinks or bring a menu, no dice. They seemed understaffed and had a large group, but that is no excuse for completely ignoring a table.  I was also shocked at the causal attire of some of the guests. I realize its summer and all, but the table next to us one gentleman was in a white tank top. Not my expectation for this type of restaurant.  So while we didn't dine at Alexi's, we did patron the owner's other restaurant and had a wonderful experience (as we always do).

XmtKFR99Jscz-IA7Hv9tcw.text: Wow was very suprised at how bad the sevice and food was...they did comp my meal though so that was nice but I could barely eat it anyhows. Worst cesar salad I've ever had, drowned in some weird dressing, and the calamari appetizer was doughy. Waited almost 10 minutes for a menu and water after asking multiple times and it really wasn't that busy.

1bjgZQBW3xyNcltQcdtCOg.text: Haven't been back here for years.  What a pleasant surprise.   Food and service excellent.  Met the owner. Mike.  Most gracious.  And our waiter Thomas was super.  Prices very reasonable for the quality of the meal. And generous wine pours.  Definitely coming back.

HrbkbEej9kVYtrKOVhmujA.text: Having never been here for dinner before we weren't sure what to expect so we were not disappointed. We started with caesar salads then wife had the salmon and I had the chicken bolognese. She said the salmon was watery and I felt the chicken was to commercial, like it had been setting on a steam table. The bill was in line with the meal plus 4 drinks but the food was not as good as it should have been. Probably won't be back.

uSvr2gVAH9wgGKDZSX1vpw.text: I was in town on March 4th from New Orleans, and my family chose this place for dinner.  Overall, the dining experience was good!  The quality of ingredients was good and my meal was prepared exactly the way I expected.  I would definitely dine here again and would also recommend.

3Ux2d8vg3Ic9OrhjdSqJoA.text: I used to travel to Phoenix for work, which was one of the benefits of that job.  This restaurant in downtown Phoenix came highly recommended by several of the secretaries I was working with and since it was in walking distance of the office, I decided to give it a try.    To be totally honest, it sucked.  Complimentary bread and soup was served for starters.  The bread was stale and I've had better soup out of a can.  The server was so busy flirting with the tall and very tanned ladies at the table next to me to pay much attention to the rest of his customers.  He spent a good deal of the time ignoring me; I was constantly having to ask him for things I shouldn't have to ask for--such as a fork or a drink.    The menu is pretty extensive; though low on the veggie options.  I chose the bowtie pasta with veggies.  It was carrots, zucchini and peppers in a light herb sauce which was bland and served just barely warm.  Very disappointing!  Due to the slow service of the flirty waiter, I was there far longer than an hour and got back to work late, out about $15 and still hungry.  Don't waste your time!

g0roGWSZU3RGzfEafkzh5g.text: Was at Alexi's for lunch yesterday with a friend. Somebody in that kitchen REALLY knows how to cook chicken!! I ordered one of their specials, which was chicken breast served with artichoke hearts and sauteed mushrooms in a lemon sauce served with rice and vegetables. The chicken was so tender and moist I could have ordered another plate. My friend had salmon with rice and veggies and she loved it! The staff was their usual friendly selves, being very welcoming when we arrived, and very helpful when taking our order!

snvSMp0zPqmrlsXMFt3kyg.text: My friends and I were enjoying a girls' weekend in Phoenix and picked Alexi's Grill due to a reservation being available on Open Table on a Friday evening (June 5, 2015). It appears we had a similar experience to another Yelper that very evening. Our server was obnoxious and condescending from the start. We asked for menus as the hostess had not given them to us, and he chastised us and said we could not have menus until we ordered drinks! So we asked for a wine list/drink menu. The server said they did not have one and we should just tell him what we liked. We're still not sure if they don't carry top shelf liquor or if the server just wouldn't share that information with us. My friend ordered a gin and tonic and I ordered a vodka martini. We are not used to well drinks, but that is what we received. As we were ordering our drinks, my friend asked for bread as she was feeling sick from not eating lunch. The server didn't know this, but he responded, "We don't bring bread until you order from the menu." Everything he said was rude and peppered with attitude. My three friends ordered the Chicken Marsala Southwest and I ordered the Eggplant Parmigiana. The server said to one of my friends, "You know that's hot, right?" and as another friend declined soup or salad he said, "You know it comes with the price of the meal?" We were just appalled at this point. The house salads were fine. We were relieved to be moving on with the evening. Then our meals were served. My eggplant was rubbery and tasteless. I can make better eggplant at home and I'm not a chef. Our server did not return until my friends were almost finished with their meals, so obviously I was not going to order a replacement meal at that point. My friends' chicken marsala meals were bland and completely uninteresting in any way. They ate them just because we hadn't had lunch and needed protein! The server did not apologize for my meal, nor did a manager come to our table. The only thing I can say that he did do that was proactive was remove it from our bill. This was the second time in my life that I have not left a server a gratuity, but he managed to make this the most unpleasant dining experience I've ever had. I would not recommend the service, the drinks, the food or the decor. I'm not sure how this place has four stars on Yelp.

WGIMUa3OWIf0qXKAvZ4XTQ.text: Best steak salad I've had in a long time. The tuxedo'd waitstaff were awesome, never wanted for a refill, plates just seemed to dissappear.

6zZdZfneCqZynQMoJuCfqQ.text: This was the most amazing place. They were more than happy to accommodate our party of 43. I called half a dozen restaurants and no one would accommodate us.  They made sure their restaurant was well stocked with dinner choices and we had several Options of steak, pasta and seafood items.  The food was absolutely delicious. The service was excellent. They were well organized and treated us with a tremendous  Amount of respect including our children. They really made us feel very important  and gave us EXCELLENT service. The shrimp cocktail, fried cheese and calamari were exceptional. I loved the chicken Milano, it was superb. The limoncello Marscapone cake is a must have. The culinary experience paired with the service was the very best we have ever had in Phoenix, AZ!! The restaurant is beautiful and we loved the atmosphere. Thank you Michael and the rest of the staff for giving us an incredible evening!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Alexi's Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ZQ7BaC70jvT9C4oX4oyZ5A.text: Before trying Alexi's, I had heard nothing but great reviews. After going there myself, I was disappointed. Low quality ingredients, lack of service and too pricey

ZZy0sTvsIx42AC06M_kCYg.text: This is must try for anyone that loves  fresh seafood and greek-italian based entrees at an unbeatable price in today's market. Fresh Alaskan halibut topped with feta cheese, tomatoes and a very addicting lemon Garlic sauce was my choice for entree. Came with house salad  and bread. Dressing was homemade and one if a kind. Entree was so delicious, fish  , very fresh and topped amazingly with the feta and sauce was awesome and simply highlighted by a delicious sweet buttery carrot side , broccolli and oven roasted potatos. And finally the chocolate mousse which maybe the best I ever had.....

qyX6IEw-ubnr82N6RBqdtw.text: Side salads are okay but the food is AWFUL. Recently I ate with some friend for lunch . I had their  Fettuccine Alfredo and it was sooooooooo salty that I could not even eat it, so gross. All I can ask myself "What kind of cooks do they have preparing the food? Do they even taste the food ? If they did then they WOULD KNOW HOW BAD IT TASTED AND HAD WAYYYYYYYYY TOO MUCH Salt " . .. This was twice in 1 year. Never again will I waste my money and time coming back.

SxlT-yd5DWiDverJPjb7Gw.text: This was a phenomenal local find. We came for lunch. The prices were quite reasonable. The chef worked with my gluten allergies. The wine list was superb and the service was top notch. The server was professional and engaging. He easily handled 6 tables alone and provided the service of a seasoned professional. This is truly a neighborhood gem.

J0CLKIHg4lj0FbBKPiAD-A.text: Always top notch food and service. Have been going there since it opened and it never falters.

esPvGhmjnteCLEg-99clNw.text: This was a wonderful food experience. The food was exquisite. My lamb chops were cooked expertly and were a delight for my palette. My wife's halibut was the same. The owner Michael came to our table, shared some dining and cooking tips and provided a 5 star experience with his personal touch. The service was wonderful without being intrusive. We are from out of town and visit downtown Phoenix 3 to 4 times a year. We will definitely return and bring friends. Magnificent!

4Ex4M9b48P4OtYeNyoQKfw.text: Seven people in the party.  We had a variety of Italian dishes and everybody enjoyed their meals.  Meals were very reasonable.  I really enjoyed the house salad dressing.  The waiter was very friendly along with the rest of the staff.  The only thing I did not enjoy was the bread.  But other than that, very good and I would definitely recommend.  Also a very nice ambiance and very cleanly.

4lYo2QhNtl-Pw_yYgHiFRw.text: I live and work nearby. I've passed this place a couple thousand times but just recently went in for the first time. What a pleasant surprise!   It's on the ground floor of a high rise and the sign is a bit plain. It appears dated to me from a drive-by perspective. But the interior is modern, crisp and clean, with white linens. The windows are spotless and give a nice view of the high rises and a nicely landscaped courtyard with a fountain. They also have an easy to use private parking lot.  The food was excellent and well priced. They have a full bar. The menu has a great blend of traditional entrees as well as elevated dishes. Pasta, steak, pork chop, and several nice seafood dishes. Homemade bread, salad dressing, sauces, etc.   The service was excellent. A unique find.  Lunch is in the $10-12 range and dinners are $15-$30.  Give Alexi's a try. Just north of the Walgreens at Central and Osborn.  I only regret not trying it sooner.

h0eOwUSuFbX2vcHoHXYaUQ.text: First timers and it was very good. Walked in 2 min before our reservations & our table was ready. Waiters were prompt with drink orders & appetizers. I had the veal chop which was cooked & seasoned perfectly. My wife had  pasta with beef tenderloin & it was very tender & tasty.  We will definitely go back!

vO4h8SzTf8Fg0Vv1khgTmw.text: Alexis's Grill was a bit of a disappointment. I made reservations to take my team out to dinner and a few were new employees. I didn't ask everyone how their meal was but if mine was any indication I'm guessing it was average at best. We started off by having water brought to the table and had to send back two of the 7 glasses that weren't just dirty but had food stuck to them very visibility; not a great first impression. I had a salad with my meal and while fresh had only lettuce, no other garnishing on it so it was somewhat boring. For a main course I had a filet that was grossly overcooked and dry. If you're going to offer an expensive piece of meat the very least you can do it not cook it to within an inch of its life. I ordered medium and there wasn't an ounce of pink. The waiter never came back and checked. I had vegetables with it and they were fine, not a lot of seasoning but at least they weren't overcooked. Someone at my table had the soup that came highly recommended by the waiter but thought it too was bland. The hostess was excellent; friendly and nice. The waiter was not overly intrusive but after delivering the meals never checked back. I didn't send my steak back because I was with work people and didn't want to make a scene. However, if the waiter had checked in and paid any attention to the doneness I would hope he would have insisted on getting it grilled right.  Overall, I was not pleased with the impression I made with my coworkers in my attempt to take them out for dinner. I will not be going back. It was a long drive for mediocre food.

9YZJsiRIcN4seTak0G0BQw.text: Have come here for many years. Had an office right across the street from the restaurant and went there a few times a week for lunch and dinner. Very good Northern Italian food and I believe it is a sister restaurant of Christos on 7th street and Missouri. If you're in the neighborhood definitely come in for their lunch specials. Staff is helpful and friendly food is cooked to order and quite tasty. Some of their dishes can be a little on the pricey side.

m9oXqacDACEuVQkjQEHA4w.text: Alexi's is a fantastic Downtown spot for a business lunch.  Our server was charming, non-abrasive, and knowledgeable - a trifecta of awesome! His recitation of the daily specials was so good that I wanted him narrating my entire day.  I ordered the grilled salmon special and subbed out rice for more veggies. It also came with a starter salad, which is always a welcome touch. The salmon was flavorful and perfectly cooked. The veggies were...well...healthy I guess. Everything was a bit salty but I can live with that.   I would definitely come back to Alexi's if work brings me back to Phoenix.

BdtKE5FDdHCA6NqaRJO9LA.text: Had my graduation dinner there last night. Excellent food and super friendly service. They accommodated my party of 19 with ease and grace. I couldn't have picked a better place!   Oh, and the food was spectacular!

3v2KVvLhKR_1cuC3_6Peog.text: What a great place to relax and have a great meal. The Alfredo and fish is delicious. The prices of the food are really reasonable. It's small and intimate which we loved. Server was great and the host was kind. We can't wait to plan our next date night here!

kYc1pXXHKvlBZ0yBsbil8w.text: Food and service were both outstanding.  I am excited to try a pasta dish next time.  Halibut was amazing! I would definitely recommend this place for lunch or dinner!

PPfAJo9NEjQuTQrnPiGJ5Q.text: Always an amazing atmosphere filled with a high quality dinning experience that will have you going back for more! There is NEVER a time where I am disappointed, and I am always treated with the most phenomenal service.  Would recommend to anyone local and non local to the area.

1K___wpRY93qdUOXVuL31g.text: Alexi's Grill & Catering 3550 N. Central Ave Phoenix, AZ  85012   As part of Restaurant Week, companion and I dined at Alexi's. Restaurant Week features prix fixe menu's with limited selections. Some restaurants use this week as an opportunity to introduce new customers to their food selections, while a few others use it to take advantage of unknowing customers. Fortunately, Alexi's does not take advantage of their customers and provides a nice meal for your dollars.   Drinks were brought quickly and we were brought a basket of warm bread sticks along with some nice salt butter. Many restaurants serve unsalted butter, which just does not have the taste that many people are looking for.   Companion started off with the Calamari appetizer. Many places destroy a wonderful appetizer by over cooking it. Here there were nice rings and tentacles lightly battered and fried to perfection. For myself, I ordered the Caprese Salad, which was made with some wonderful buffalo mozzarella, ripe tomatoes, and a chiffonade of basil. Some excellent olive oil and a dash of balsamic completed the dish nicely.   Next, cups of bean soup arrived. This was no ordinary bean soup, did not come from a can, and did not come from the freezer. This soup was made from scratch with love and attention to detail. Tiny canele beans with small diced carrots enhanced with a beautiful broth type soup. No heavy glop here, if they offered this soup canned, I'd be buying it by the case.   For the main course, companion ordered the Lobster Ravioli in a cream sauce. Five nice sized ravioli's gently swimming in a pool of excellent cream sauce. Very rich and quite satisfying.   I ordered the Pork Chop cooked pink, as the USDA now allows pork to be cooked. A good sized chop on the bone arrived perfectly cooked as ordered. The chop was accompanied by al dente broccoli, roasted baby potatoes, and some outstanding sweet carrots that were stars of the show. Companion kept stealing some from my plate!   Dessert consisted of Cheesecake with macerated strawberries, and Tiramisu.   Service was excellent, and cleanliness even to the outside areas was in evidence. Dings - only one - when any restaurant serves a nice piece of meat, be it steak or chop, it is wrong to serve a serrated knife to the person dining. The serrated knife only serves to tear the meat apart instead of gently slicing it into edible portions. It bothered me to look at my knife after cutting this excellent chop and find pieces of meat stuck to the blade.   4 stars for service, quality of food, and cleanliness

ndzFCifTcdnukn1OHHs4Lw.text: Absolutely  the best calamari in Phoenix.  I have been disappointed at so many other place with rubbery calamari. This is sweet and very tender. Congrats!

photos.caption: Photo of Alexi's Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

SEHI2NbI3DGi50OJ0zfueQ.text: Alexi's Grill is an authentic, well-known & established restaurant in Downtown Phoenix. The service is amazing and the outside seating is perfect in the cooler months.  Our server was very knowledgeable and attentive throughout the night. We sat outside on the patio, under the lights & enjoyed a very high-end meal.  The house salads (that come with each entree) are delicious and placed in perfect portions. I will be back to Alexi's!

tGtNQcl2aQygpIXB8X207w.text: I'm a little confused by all the 5 star reviews because I've been here a dozen times and the food always seems pretty average and under seasoned. When you walk in, the look and feel of the place and the service say "upscale" but the food doesn't match. The prices are pretty good though and it's close to work so I find myself meeting friends at Alexi's for lunch fairly often, always hoping the food will get a little bit better. I would recommend they change up the menu occasionally as well. It's been the same for the last year and a half at least and it could use a revamp.  The marcus pasta is the best dish I've had here but the sauce is thin and it usually needs some salt. Not a horrible restaurant but any means, but there's a lot of room for improvement food-wise. Excellent service though!

XKtROOxtOGnwmcSNOM_fIA.text: This is a nice, homey restaurant that has a fancyish vibe. The server was really personable and the quality of the food was good. I got the chicken marsala southwest and thought it was okay, but I really loved the side salad it came with! It was a quieter place, so if you're here with a larger group that's something to be aware of. For how much I paid, I wish I was more impressed by my entree. I really did love the personality of the server and how I felt like our table was always attended to!

O26zNSzHuv0n7mIfGXugIA.text: Since I always judge an Italian restaurant by its Eggplant Parm, you know what I ordered.  I admit to being tempted by the halibut (served to the guests at an adjacent table), and I haven't had Duck a l'Orange in ages (and when the waiter added the descriptor "crispy" I nearly caved).  I'm glad I chose the Eggplant Parmesan, though.  It was perfect.  As good as it gets.  There is ample parking here, a big plus for venues in this area.  The restaurant is attractive and well appointed (white table cloths and much more flatware than you normally get).  The service was impeccable.  I was in a hurry to get to theater or I would have had Tiramisu.  Bet it's delish.  The only minor disappointment was the bread:  some odd white breadsticks--not the usual Italian loaf you'd expect.  But the eggplant...

Q44x38KgNreb4eFf0SsiQg.text: Food was good............but the waiter brought me the wrong entree and it took 15 min to bring me the right one while my guest ate his food.  The waiter forgot to bring us our check (15 min after we asked for it)........Disappointing

19_ugNr5Lg5spfBZqE_Bug.text: Sometimes, timing is everything. And in this case, it was bomb.com! I guess it is common to make a reservation here, but being the tourists that we were, we didn't. We arrived and the lady asked if we had a reservation. When I told her no, her face turned and she told us to wait a moment. Luck was on out side, because somehow they were able to get us in and seated. Once we entered the dining room, there was no table available. Whew! They have a good menu with a lot of options for vegetarians/pescatarians! I was super impressed. I ordered the shrimp scampi and the noodles were cooked perfectly. They were the right texture and the shrimp was so tasty and succulent. No skimping on the shrimping either! Plenty come with the dish so you don't have to ration your shrimp over the course of your meal. The bread served was also addicting. Cause I. Love. Bread. I ate so much of it, with the butter melting on the inside. Just scrumptious. Due to a large party, the amount of time it took for the food to come out was a little longer than I expected, but the staff were so kind, they apologized and offered free dessert, which who turns that down? I ate off my moms Limencello Mascarpone Cake, and our spoons were fighting over the next bite. You can tell this is a family place. As people were leaving, they would address them by name, and the guest would reply, "See you next time!" And I can see why.

BCLIB72l4a5FVCSQ6gq0Mg.text: We had never been there before. It was chosen by friends and we had a wonderful time celebrating my birthday. Service was excellent and we had a delicious meal. We will definitely be back.

-i5ipXnOyF81Af8P18RJeg.text: Some friends, family, and I had a very nice two-hour lunch celebrating a special occasion today.  The food is as tasty as it is nutritious.  For starters, I had soup and salad.  My entree came with a medley of vegetables including yellow squash and zucchini.  To top off the meal, we indulged in the most delicious Limoncello Mascarpone cake.  It makes my mouth water - just to think of it.  Alexi's Grill is one of Phoenix's best kept secrets.  At Osborn and Central, there is plenty of parking.  It is also a great place to visit on Friday and Saturday evenings for the downtown events.  Call ahead though!

photos.caption: Photo of Alexi's Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is one of my favorite desserts at Alexi&#39;s Grill - Limoncello Mascarpone - you cannot go wrong!

IReqLsRsxq_Q-ow8ZzyMdw.text: Came here due to the reviews about the food and the happy hour. It's on the first floor of a high rise which is a bit strange but I could look past it. The restaurant itself is bizarre...fancier than I expected. Happy hour is only in the bar, but you can't get dinner in the bar area. However, you can sit in the restaurant area and walk up to the bar to get drinks on happy hour. What??? Doesn't make any sense. The food was very good but I wouldn't come back here. Vibe is weird. Service was great too but for a place boasting a great happy hour and great food when you can't get both at the same time? No thanks

BUHotUa8H3Grnc0HQ-DeXg.text: I was in town for work and the front desk at the hotel directed me to Alexis. Loved it! I sat at the bar and arrived with a few minutes left to happy hour. Their happy hour ends at 7. Wonderful happy hour! I had so many wines to chose from and great appetizers offered.   THe bartender, Rick, was very sweet and also offered to put in another glass of wine before happy hour ended. I would've only had one but after this nice gesture I obviously couldn't turn down the second glass.   I ordered the appetizer mussels in white wine sauce. They were delicious. The pricing was great on al the entrees.   The lightning was dim so this looked like a nice romantic place for a date. The customers were very friendly. It was a rather older crowd and you could tell they were regulars. It was someone birthday bray and when they sang happy birthday most of the restaurant chimed in. I would absolutely love to make this my regular bar/restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Alexi's Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bar area
Photo of Alexi's Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mussels . $13.00

zP_r2H5exS4Mza1LoWFPIQ.text: Every time we are in Phoenix we come here.  Great food and a quiet environment.  Nice to actually have great food and enjoy your company!!

JONLzgBUqisx8MSclpkg2Q.text: Oh wow!!! Boyfriend brought me to Alexi's tonight for my birthday and EVERYTHING was phenomenal!! I had the halibut Athenian and he had the filet.... perfection all around!! Our service was amazing and as it was my birthday, they brought me out a piece of yummy cake!!

8MwrQffPUXKy7Frm9AYZZg.text: Met some friends here during Restaurant Week. The food was very good, but we had to ask for bread. Cocktails were slow but our disappointment ended there!  Food, atmosphere, pace of meal...all were exceptionally solid. The restaurant week menu included dessert and we tried the limoncello cake...whoa!  Tastebuds are still recovering from this out of this world treat!

AJh6vwvmcAaoRMFDzaqbpg.text: I wish I could give Alexi's 10 Stars! By far (leaps and bounds) one of the best restaurant in the Phoenix Metro area and one of the biggest surprises is the affordability of the food! Each time I come here I am pleasantly surprised of the reasonableness of the cost which is surprising as the food is absolutely superb!  You can not go wrong here, the staff, food and atmosphere is an astounding 10!

aghVlKFbw9v6pJbEEW9SRg.text: I want to start by saying the service was impeccable but the food so so.  We started with the mussels in white wine sauce that were nearly inedible... The rest of the meal was just ok..

THfxWidsViD5_jNgln89Pw.text: Great happy hour food! I had the $5 blackened Cesar salad and $8 combo plate (shrimp, calamari, tortellini) and it was amazing. Good quality food and cooked perfectly. The drinks were well priced too - $5 wines, margaritas, and $2.50 bottled beers. This place looks like it's been around forever and I assume lots of regular diners.  I went for lunch today and got the chicken tortellini and didn't like it - but I think it was my fault because I didn't realized it was soaked in a Alfredo type sauce and I'm never into that. Definitely check it out for a happy hour snack/meal if you're in the area though.

photos.caption: Photo of Alexi's Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. $5 happy hour blackened Cesar salad. Delicious
Photo of Alexi's Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. $8 happy hour combo plate! Shrimp, calamari, tortellini, garlic bread. Order this.
Photo of Alexi's Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The side salad that comes before lunch entree. Simple but tasty.

D6oL9gzEMaY4JhdN9hgCLA.text: The food was delicious  The service was great! The ambiance is so so. Its a  professional atmosphere. The patio could use some spicing up

TX6hU0ehrs6YDhlLylLcUg.text: Lovely patio with water feature and friendly wait staff. We ordered the meatballs over penne, bruschetta, pulled pork pita and appetizer combo to try this place out. My boyfriend really enjoyed the pulled pork appetizer and I enjoyed the shrimp scampi in the combo. All of the appetizers and drinks were good, none were what I would consider great. Based on reviews and the staff/atmosphere I would consider trying this place again for an entree.

pkZWhx7xFG7zKuD7apPchw.text: There are things about this restaurant that we adored and things that were mediocre. The location of this restaurant is a suppliers' market. The hostess was amazing, the servers were slow. I don't recommend anything with the marinara. It's bland and lacks seasoning and general fresh-tomato-ness. The calamari was chewy and the fried cheese boring. HOWEVER our party thoroughly enjoyed the halibut special, the filet, and the lobster ravioli. Veal shank was largely left behind. Carrots were so sweet we all only ate one. Broccoli was fabulous. Salad boring. Bread fair. Atmosphere charming and nestled in a boring and somewhat barren part of town.
