j8rlUG_QrOhy18e6UNUycA.text: I love this place! The atmosphere is very classy, refined, but relaxed. The staff are smart and attentive, very helpful. The food is excellent! I've had various dishes here on occasion and they have all been great. The salad items are fresh, crisp and tasty, the entrees (for example chicken and salmon) are cooked to perfection and the soups are great too - Awesome value for a great meal.

tOkTVCJEsWWH4IaHGeVyEA.text: Was easy to get to, make a reservation on Friday night. Best calamari steak I've had.  Staff very friendly and accommodating! Will return!

HTRFI8B20Lpq6gW1t1d2zw.text: I was invited to a Christmas party at Alexi's I  tagged along for the free booze but the food was amazing. For appetizers they served stuffed mushrooms, jumbo shrimp cocktail , and crackers with cheese. For dinner we were served chicken marsala, halibut topped with feta cheese and tomatoes, and tortellini alfredo.  Everything was fresh and delicious I was really impressed by the quality of food that was served I will definitely be back for more :)

SikspOO4_a9-hwg148tAhA.text: Wow, what a downer for my only chance to eat out in Phoenix.  Here on business with many colleagues, the choice was made to eat at Alexi's since it was an extremely short drive to the hotel where we were staying. Our party consisted of 8 adults who were all extremely hungry and ready to place our orders after waiting for a table for a short period of time..not more than 15 minutes.   For a Monday night, I must say that the place was pretty packed.  The server was a very kind, sweet man who came across as quick, but lagged terribly with everything.  I am thinking it could have well been the delay inside the kitchen--not him...as again, he was pretty efficient. We ordered some appetizers of caprese = good, and fried calamari = ok.  Their bread that they provide = okay--nothing extraordinary. Most of us were ready to order quite quickly, but the food just took absolutely forever.  We probably started eating our food around 8:30pm, after being there for more than an hour munching on our appetizers which were devoured in seconds and sipping on our beverages. The food all in all, everyone said was mediocre and regretted what they ordered.  The steak was dry, my colleague said, the sauce was too heavy and drowning the food, another said, and so on... One colleague left her nearly full plate behind and said that the taste was off from what she was expecting. I ordered the chicken marsala which was really good actually, but just way too much sauce...You couldn't even taste the chicken--just sauce! For a hungry bunch of out-of-towners, Alexi's was certainly nothing special. I probably wouldn't recommend this place to anyone coming to downtown Phoenix...business or pleasure.  I gave them two stars because the server was very cordial and the servers overall gave a nice impression.

J9X4QcIQtXIIfvMOKtQKJw.text: I travel a lot on business, and this is my must go to restaurant in downtown Phoenix. Terrific service in every way. Problem is I never get to try other items on the menu because one dish demands I order it every time. The Halibut Athenia is simply put the best fish preparation I've ever had. Huge portion of fresh halibut oven roasted with tomatoes, feta cheese and herbs. Words do not do it justice. Not on the regular menu but often a special. Just ask for it. It's unbelievable.

wu1573iMPti_E6xbGgVeKA.text: Old school Italian restaurant located on the first floor of a Central Ave. high rise, Alexi's delivers great food with great service. The room is nicely appointed (nicely appointed?...who says things like that?), comfortable and really reminds me of an upper westside NYC restaurant. Pasta pomodoro, shrimp parmigiana, minestrone soup, house salad all dee lish. It reminds of an NYC restaurant. Hostess in a tight dress. Waitresses all with big hair. Older waiters, follicly challenged and oddly all with moustaches. Naked Cowboy on the sidewalk. Ok, maybe not THE naked cowboy. But one day I did see a cowboy type with daisy dukes and a muscle shirt that read "My belt buckle's bigger than yours". Hmmm. Anyway, the clientele seems to be older Scottsdale type, women in furs and men with furry backs, who dare to venture into Central Phoenix. Me? I show up in my board shorts, Hello Kitty flip flops and a muscle shirt that says "My debt is bigger than yours". ENJOY yelpers!

TfcA7eEn1ufaUxKmaWdJDw.text: It is by far one of the best meals I have EVER had! Although it seems to not be 100% authentic Italian- it is Italian based, fresh, and wonderful! I only wish this wasn't the only location as I am here on travel. And only $12!

bP5H5YBCNPdk0Ri7y6U1qg.text: I have been eating at Alexi's for many years. I find the food to be wonderful each and every time I visit. The entire staff makes you feel  like a member of the family. The portions are a perfect size.     The rack of lamb is superb! The Monday pasta has wonderful flavor and tender chicken! I would definitely recommend Alexi's to anyone.

kI-wi9T9WzujfT4kX9lagg.text: This was within walking distance from the hotel we were staying at, so glad we found it. The service was impeccable, the food was delicious, and the atmosphere was pleasant. We had an extremely rude diner next to us, playing YouTube car racing videos at full volume, and the hostess dealt with it in a very professional manner. Our server, Gatsby, was awesome. The restaurant was unexpectedly slammed that night and everyone was overwhelmed, but he totally kept his cool and provided top notch service. Would absolutely dine again.

eiDwxkcYy7zo8jISh8yWQw.text: Unfortunately our visit started off on the wrong foot. My husband and I had made a reservation for 5pm and arrived at 4:55, the hostess said that it would be a few minutes and that we could sit at the bar-not a problem for us since we knew we were early. Well 5 came and past and we were still sitting at the bar, there was literally every single table open in the restaurant, so it's not like we were waiting for someone to leave. Completely open restaurant. Another couple walk in and were immediately seated while we were still sitting at the bar (not drinking literally just sitting there waiting to be seated). The hostess then tells us we are next after she had walked by us while seating the other couple. Disappointing to be overlooked and ignored right off the bat.   Luckily after finally being seated the server promptly took our order and was very attentive throughout the meal. We ordered the meatballs to start and the filet mignon and the vodka tortellini for our meals which were  amazing. The food was very good quality for the price.   If it wasn't for the saving grace of the food and wait staff I would have left with the bad taste in my mouth that started the visit.

--ClWJU3yZyI9MR0ScAACQ.text: Just north of the hustle and bustle of downtown Phoenix located on the first floor of an office building.  Lots of parking.    A little upscale as white linens drape the tables along with a plethora of silverware.  Tables are nicely spaced to allow easy access and private conversations.  The little vegetable garden, plants and trees surrounding the front of the restaurant bring a little tranquility to central phoenix.  Came here for Arizona Restaurant Week with several friends.    The Caprese salad  was good. I wish they could have jazzed it up with a drizzle of balsamic vinegar. The Calamari was plentiful and was good.  The soup of the day was cream of mushroom.  It was the best dish of the evening.  The salad was basically romaine lettuce with a wedge of tomato with a oil/vinegar dressing was boring.  The dressing needed some herbs to give life to the salad.  Everyone had the pork chops.   It was a very large cut, but it was overcooked.  The meat was dry and difficult to cut with the knife.  The accompanying demi-glace and vegetables were very good.  I would come here again to try some of the other food.  I like the atmosphere.  Staff are extremely nice and well trained.

Ll66kyVr9qLtJzjxNmfoqQ.text: We enjoyed a nice happy hour with friends who recommended Alexi's Grill. The Cadillac margarita was amazing along with the food on the happy hour menu. We also indulged in the limoncello cake for dessert. Nice atmosphere and great customer service by the wait staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Alexi's Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sliders with fries
Photo of Alexi's Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Swedish meatballs
Photo of Alexi's Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Homemade Meatballs

xAfAPgpAxISx2MwgSLP1Sg.text: Lunch meet at Alexi's Grill in Phoenix. Have been here many times for lunch. Good news is that parking is free and in a big lot just to the south of the restaurant. Never had less than very good meals here.  We ordered three appetizers including the calamari, mozzorella sticks, and meatball and penne. Hands down the best was the calamari. It was very tender and served with a very light coating.   I had the gyro and salad. Others had various pasta dishes and sandwiches. The gyro was tasty and filling. It was served open face. The salad had a nice vinegarette dressing.  Service was excellent. White linen tablecloth with black cloth napkins, yet the lunch prices were very reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of Alexi's Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gyro Sandwich

ekZLrGsRi9uvwQjwmYrJ9A.text: What an absolutely delightful restaurant!! My parents have been coming here for years before they head out to a play. However, my mom passed away in 2010, so my dad hadn't been back since her death. Well, I bought us some tickets for West Side Story st the Ph. Theatre located down the street from Alexi's Grill. Pop mentioned that he and mom would eat here back in the day, so I figured let's see if they are still around. Thank God they were!   Pop called a day or so before we arrived to see if they had Osso Bucco. They didn't have it but said they would pick up the ingredients from their sister restaurant, Christo's and would prepare it for him! Now that's great service!! The food was to die for, too! I had the veal chop, and my husband had the rack of lamb! It was delicious! We also had calamari and mussels for appetizers and they were equally as good!   All I know is that I can't wait to return and bring my Smart Set Sisters with me!

photos.caption: Photo of Alexi's Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bone in Vealchop!
Photo of Alexi's Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ORyO-JhAYz-2jUJ5DK1yHA.text: Food is a little bland, service is a little slow, but they really went out of their way to make the evening special.

g1biZEDNGPl_rqdULErbjg.text: I've been a long time fan of this mid-town phoenix, neighborhood grill.  I have dined here for years, due to the fact that two of my friends work at nearby office buildings.This was was our go to for our lunch get-togethers.  Even though it seems as if this place had been overshadowed by many of the nearby newer and hipper establishments this stalwart restaurant has been a gem to the informed dining patron.  Surprisingly, I've taken many of my friends and family here but neglected to take my beloved wife here. Imagine that! I endeavored to correct that oversight, and committed to making reservations one Wednesday evening.  Why Wednesday, you may ask? Because any night is date night, and Wednesday's is art and culture night in mid-town Phoenix. The Phoenix Art Museum is open late, and would make a great accompaniment to a wonderful dining experience.  Upon arrival, we were promptly seated by the friendly hostess.  Our server made a mad dash to ensure that we were promptly attended to, with nary a delay.  He went over that evening's specials, and we opted for both of them. I had the grilled and glazed chicken with mushrooms. My wife had the Glazed 16 ounce pork chop.  The sauce that enveloped the glazed chicken was absolutely sublime. It was a little on the sweeter side, but not overwhelmingly so. The accompanying vegetables such as the broccoli, glazed carrots and potatoes were perfectly prepared - not overdone, but not raw either. Their tender and succulent consistencies were heavenly.  Speaking of heavenly, my wife's Glazed Pork Chop, although overkill for most anyone's appetite, was just simply incomparable. Prepared like a steak, but considerably tender on the inside. It seemed to definitively declare that it truly was better than the other white meat!   Every bite just melted in both our mouths (we often try to share our main course choices), and the glazing gave it such a rich texture.  The service has never failed me. The servers are always polite and charming - full of personality, and thoroughly engaging.  This turned out to be an amazing choice for a mid-week date night. Or any other date night, for that matter.  Then it was off to the Art Museum, to walk off all the carbs!

boR-RoflENiDWzjBwREZ8Q.text: Good place for business lunch. Not exceptional but good value Italian dishes that are generous and tasty.

MnLHz6YWHqwjS984l8tmFw.text: Wow, Alexi's has a killer happy hour! I had no idea! Located near Downtown Phoenix, this centrally located gem has been a Phoenix staple for years, so I'm told! The best part, their happy hour goes until 7p! Yes, please! Even the working folk can make it here in time for some light bites and snazzy spirits.   Beer and cocktails range from $2-$5. The best part, select martinis are only $5! I had a tasty lemon drop! For HH food, the potions are big and can definitely be a meal! They offer meatballs, calamari, Caesar salad with blackened chicken, Caprese salad, a combo plate, and more for $5-$8! Pretty much everything is $5 except for the combo (shrimp scampi, calamari, tortellini) is $8. Such a steal!   I'll definitely be back for happy hour before doing something fun downtown! They also offer catering if you're looking for that.

zJVBAC-doXZBEVh1P-0pQw.text: A neighborhood gem!     I frequently go here.  The staff is very friendly and accommodating..  The Phoenix International Supper Club UYE chose Alexi's as our 5th year Anniversary restaurant.  Of course they were nothing shy of pleasant and amazing service with a smile.    On the regular, I couldn't afford a place like Alexi's every week.  But they have an amazing Happy Hour!  $5 cocktails and $5 appetizers.  My favorites are the calamari and Caesar salad.  Their patio is pretty nice in the fall and spring.  It is in just the right position to enjoy the beautiful glows and sparkles of colors in the Sonoran Desert Sky.     Return Facto: 100%

eUC-nUVkJe7JOF1iugMR7w.text: Wine at happy hour and then we moved over to our table for a quick dinner before going downtown Phoenix. Loved my lamb chops and other person had filet mignon and both plates with carrots and potatoes. Salad was delicious; service was perfect; hopped on the light rail in time to travel downtown.

Ph1pevLhAVB5Z-Z3IU__Rg.text: I don't know how I managed to pass by this place so many times and not noticed it.  Adorable affordable seafood spot centrally located.  I love the happy hour, I will be back.

dUAC5PWDraXahFwLhEfGNA.text: While this restaurant caters to an older clientele, the food options are tasty!  A white cloth Italian restaurant with a sizable wine list.  Portion sizes are ample, freshly prepared and served by a friendly staff that caters to either a show schedule or a leisurely meal.  I had the chicken Marsala, with a rich sauce and side veggies including potatoes, broccoli and sweet carrots seasoned with cinnamon. The only disappointment was the bread, I expected a crunchy crust French, but the basket contained something closer to a brown and serve roll.

f5ouQM_xKE4OFLAeKwA4Ug.text: Considering that I enjoy trying out different establishments for happy hour, it is surprising that I wasn't able to try Alexi's until my circle of yelp friends decided to come here for a UYE. The location is very convenient - along Central Avenue in central Phoenix - and parking is no problem. The restaurant is spacious and service is friendly and efficient. The happy hour offerings are surprisingly inexpensive: from 2 to 5 bucks for brews and cocktails and 5 to 8 bucks for happy hour bites ... well, more than just bites actually; the servings are pretty generous so that you'll probably consider it a meal. Good to know that we have this relaxed, casual destination for happy hour in the central corridor, and I should make it a point to come try their regular meals soon.

YICL-Lr3rWM8Zn8T3L8Exg.text: Went here for lunch with Co workers and it wasn't pleasant. Got there at 11:30 and we were seated right away 3 other tables were occupied. We were seated not giving menus had to request 2 times. Finally got the menus and tried to order but had to flag down the waiter again. By now the place is filling up and people are getting there food and we are still trying to get outlr order in. Finally it was in and we waited and waited. We finally had to ask for our checks and to have our food to go. Not a good experience at all.

pQiQH3sMQ1GyXrFdqIIbxQ.text: Extremely courteous service. Food was excellent and prepared in a timely manner. If I'm even in Phoenix again I'm definitely coming back here.

-9N0ta3MjSwleErkmkSnAg.text: A bit less formal and a lot less rushed than its sister resto Christo's, with excellent food and service in a downtown eatery. We had the lamb and a sea bass. Always very good. They are great at getting you out on time if you are dining pre theater or  concert just let them know!

KMJrZMIaqU1t50UpBdblhQ.text: Happy Hour Review: Rendezvous with some Yelper buds for a happy hour soiree. Alexi's definitely puts the happy in happy hour. How can you go wrong with Apps for 5 bucks and a decent selection of wine and cocktails for.... you guessed it 5 bucks. I had a nice full glass of their chianti selection and it was not bad for a HH wine. I ordered their combo plate that put me out an additional 3 bucks but hey I'm a big spender!?! There was shrimp, calamari, and tortellini and it was perfect. Yea I could have ordered another but it was portioned well for the price. I did see the other specials roll by and they all looked wonderful and there was not a complaint from the group. Service for our large party was excellent. Alexi's is on my must return list  HH and/or dinner.

c92Xlcb2mZJPU8ofUw1LSw.text: What a pleasant surprise to have a very good Italian restaurant in Central Phoenix - my appetizer was grilled egg plant  which was delicious and savory... As my entree I had penne pasta With chicken and pesto... It was also pretty good... As the wine selection I had a red Rich wine which went very well with the meal;  Table service was very attentive and professional... The waiter was very knowledgeable and recommended the choice dish as well as complemented me on the wine selection... Overall this was a very good dining experience.

ighotMNcZ6LUJHQeicGNlg.text: We were in Phoenix for the TNNA Trade Show this past weekend and ate here several nights. There were always several in our party and everyone's dinner was wonderful. And the poached salmon is just the best!   Thomas was our server and we found him to be quite exceptional.....and funny too. The second night that we walked in the staff recognized us and treated us as if we were one of their regulars.  Alexi's has that friendly atmosphere that makes you feel as if you have been going there for years. And did I mention Thomas......he is the best!

aEiQuwETY13llP1piEon6g.text: Good food, great service -this place is good to impress your clients and your date.

nxJhrAQPTtY_Si1KFmQ1bg.text: Have been here many times and always feel the decor needs updating, but the service is always warm snd friendly and the halibut signature dish satisfies.reasonable wine prices and nice selection.

adqscE99c50y-hpyg2OyBQ.text: This place is the best in town! I get whatever soup they have when I come here, and it never disappoints. They give meaning to what True hospitality looks like. The staff is friendly and personable from the bartender to the bus boys; they treat you like family. This is a hard trait to maintain when one runs such a high quality restaurant, but they manage to have such a great balance without it feeling stuffy. I would recommend this place for large parties, catering, or for a great happy hour. I promise you won't be disappointed.

vT_HukQzsvmj198DEnnQgA.text: Sooo sad tonite. My food ok, but husband's drink started out with a majorly cracked martini glass, the wrong dish served & no one coming by to make sure all was ok. The restaurant wasn't full & the service definitely suffered tonite. It's a great value for good food though. I'm definitely disappointed that no management stopped over to check on us especially after this broken glass that they dared serve a drink in:(. We've been customers here for a long time:(  We never even received  an apology from the server.:(

sK2vPkFhgXfFfVXwzHhoaw.text: Had a great time enjoying Northern Italian with some Greek options also.  This place has it ALL! Duck, veal, shrimp, salmon, lamb, halibut, chicken, pasta, calamari, and meatballs!  It was all very delicious and the service was great.  The servers had great personalities and the ambiance is upscale and dim.  Nice patio also.  Accessible via the lightrail for those of you that take advantage of public transportation.

zb7IDoaj0Vh9_kBlQqFvIQ.text: The food was excellent, wait staff very efficient and the parking was easily accessible and convenient.  All meals were very reasonable in price as well as the drinks.  Could use a larger wine variety.

XSrkUVuIwQwQ6a3Ed-OYjg.text: The veal chop and pasta was absolutely delicious.  The cocktails by Matthew were thebest we have ever had and we have had them all over the world.  Quality of food and service is exemplary.  Customers service is beyond exemplary.  Thank you.  Jack and Bev Sinbelian

vqLXpnlNJKQVy5ZqMs57hg.text: Alexi's is hands down the best place for happy hour. Superior service, and the most amazing Chicken Caesar salad. I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a great happy hour, lunch place and/or dinner spot. It's a hidden gem in Central Phoenix.

zuxTClFS0k-ID35RqXpYmg.text: Had a nice lunch with a colleague yesterday.  The salmon was cooked perfectly, the service was attentive, but not obsequious.  Alexi's is an excellent place to bring a client, as it is professional, but not stuffy, and quiet enough to hold a conversation, but not too quiet that confidential conversations are overheard.  The prices are reasonable.  My only suggestion is for Alexi's to offer a variety of side dishes, rather than green beans and rice every day.

oKbuDTB3h5X0gYm9ovow8w.text: Not sure why it is called a "grill." Grill gives the impression of a laid back atmosphere. Alexi's is anything but. My daughters and I were out and about in downtown Phoenix and wanted Italian. We were tired of the Spaghetti Factory, so we found this place on yelp. We walked in and I was immediately regretting the decision, but the girls were hungry. First of all, the staff are dressed in formal shirts and the table linens are white. The impression is that it is meant for business meals. It is stuffy and not at all welcoming. For lunch, it should be laid back. The food was heavy Italian meals and salads. No kids meal was offered, so my daughter and I shared. We started with Provolone Fritta. It was a little overfried and the sauce was just a bit oversalted. It needed more sauce for the large pieces. We shared the chicken parmigiana. The chicken had a bizarre taste to it, so I didnt eat most of it. The salad before the meal was great though. Great dressing with lots of greens. Could have used more veggies. My other daughter had linguini w marinara. She seemed to like it. All in all, meals to make you sleep. Not family friendly.

XJDE8e-wHE5joEdqDCpuVA.text: Great Happy Hour! Can't wait to try the lamb. Also a real treat to see Micheal working!!!!!

qBXhtuBVnaP7HOxosNNI2g.text: The manager has contacted me after the weekend and refunded the tip plus an additional credit. So I was pleased with the way the management handled the situation. Thank you for taking care of this!

EoAxabhSCg-dKnQMiFxtBQ.text: I was brought here by my boss, so it was sort of a business dinner.  I wasn't able to try the cocktails that looked so good on the happy hour signs.  Each course comes with soup or salad.  I have to say, the salad I had was delicious.  I was surprised, usually a complimentary salad only includes iceberg lettuce and carrots.  This salad had all the good stuff.  I had the shrimp scampi.  It was delicious, but SO MUCH garlic.  The angel hair pasta that it come with was great.  All in all, a great experience with perfect service.

EMbcYKGDuNPkIy7iyf3EcQ.text: Love it here!  The happy hour is great, especially if you like $3 Fat Tires to go with your $5 appetizers.  For those of you who don't like beer, check out their wine menu and don't forget to eat some delicious food while you are at.  My favorite?  Too many to list, but if it comes from this kitchen, its GOOD!

6ejhyuVnBA4g9cXhOX1U7A.text: Alexi's is somewhere between Greek and Italian, closer to the latter. No matter - each entree is outstanding in its own right. Last time in the desert cannelloni was spicy and delicious - and totally hopped up on chile peppers. The salmon salad - magnificent - and perfectly cooked. The food is excellent AND it's a great place to hob-nob. The area has a loyal clientele of movers and shakers. Alexi's is highly recommended in midtown - one of the best places especially for lunch in Phoenix.

SgJs_nf-ZWziwZM5vKG91A.text: So my sister says come meet us for drinks! I say OK where to!?!?! Off to Alexi's hmmmm ok I trust you! It was after 7 and dead dead dead in here. The wait staff and bartender were watching baseball I think I'm not so sure so theres like 7 of us thirsty folk we just went to drink so this review is solely based on service pretty much. Nice open patio with no one else being there we were able to be as rowdy as we wanted. I would however like to try their food and see if it is any good. Everyone was very polite and attentive there ended up being 12+ people and they didnt separate the tabs so minus the one star so sorry.

c7ivUj_RDhCnwoW1cCiG6w.text: So...I've driven by this place a million times and always wanted to try it. What a disappointment! My family is Italian and this place is as Americanized as it gets! I got the vodka tortellini dish. Was NOT good. If you are looking for an awesome vodka sauce, check out Maggiano's in Scottsdale. It's the best I've had here in Phoenix. The atmosphere is really odd almost slightly creepy. We went for dinner and sitting in an office dinning room having dinner is somewhat strange. It is on the first floor of and office building so I can understand but still. Maybe this place makes more sense at lunch time but for dinner, weird. Check out their website and you will notice no pictures of the dining room. alexisgrillphx.com Our server was homophobic. There were three of us, myself and my two friends. He was cold and unfriendly. Being in the "gayborhood" I was pretty surprised. We all felt awkward and uninvited. Bad food, strange atmosphere for dinner, unfriendly server. I won't be coming back.

jZ4Oxn_MITzME4-7qDDI2g.text: It's "Americanized" Italian - lots of "parmigiana" items, and Alfredo sauce - but for what it is I think they do a decent job of it. I had the eggplant parmigiana and it was surprisingly good! thick slices of eggplant with just the right texture, not greasy and not to cheesy. It filled me up enough to not be able to eat much of the linguine with red sauce. the red sauce was definitely serviceable, and the pasta fine but not exciting. My companions had the grilled salmon and the chicken. The salmon was a nice "lunch-sized" hunk. I was impressed by the option of drilled salmon and at least one other fish (I cannot remember what). The chicken-eater thought it was a bit dry, but commented that he thinks all restaurant chicken is dry...yeah, i too wonder why he keeps ordering it. The starter salads were a simple romaine hunks in a house dressing. Crisp and refreshing, but once again no excitement.   I went for a business lunch and the atmosphere was perfectly enjoyable. Bright and airy, not too crowded. It's more business like than going to The Duck or Postinos (both of whose food is better), so it's a good option for taking clients, meeting associates, etc. to talk shop. I wouldn't make it a destination place, but it's a perfectly acceptable uptown lunch option. I don't think I'd bother with it for dinner.

svikhgPgBYPaMKWDooh6gA.text: Fine dining for average folk! I love this place.  There were three specials going on that were off menu which caters to different diets I suppose. The flounder dish I had was excellent

NrPsGi5B4stVqbcGaIyYjQ.text: This was my first visit. Overall, I liked the lunch. We were acknowledged when entering and was able to pick our table. Our server was prompt and checked on us frequently during the meal. We ordered Eggplant Parmesan.  Everything tasted good but we personally like a more fried eggplant with a thinner slice. We will definitely return to try other items. I also loved the white table clothes which is hard to find.

NEy7lfxcDInwvpt9oLRkAg.text: Alexis Grill has never disappointed! The service is always wonderful, and the owner always checks on your experience. All of the food that I have had at the restaurant is always cooked well and very tasty. The food is cooked in a timely manner too, so you aren't sitting around waiting for your food forever. The caesar salad is the best I've ever had!  Very nice place for a date night, or just to get away. Dim lighting, and candles on every table help with the ambiance of the restaurant. Dress is closer to business casual, with most men wearing a polo and nice pants or similar, and women are dressed up more than just daily wear.   I can not recommend this place enough!

S0DTgVaDvT9uZBpNPQM_jg.text: A beautiful waiting area outside with a running waterfall was like being at a country club. Attractive upscale restaurant. Spacious feel with big windows looking at the outside greenery. Tables were arranged conveniently for our big group. Great service by waiter who was professional, pleasant and on top of things. Food was wonderful. Loved my entree, Veracrusano. perfectly sauteed cod in unique spicy marinara and served with pasta.  Tiramasu was best ever. A future visit will be to try their lunch menu.

S_6I6ykg_lirvw_x91fE2A.text: A cozy "home made" Italian restaurant, good sized lunch menu with variety. They have your classic Italian dishes such as chicken parmigiana, fettuccini Alfredo and the pomodoros and the staff is quick and friendly! Their breadsticks were delicious and it really makes you feel at home.  I am giving it three stars because while I enjoyed the spot and the food, I didn't think it was anything over the top special, but I would keep it in mind next time I am feeling like enjoying some more authentic Italian dishes.

kj44iBhrh0aXUsE3hcu3iA.text: We came on a Tuesday night. Service is polite and amazing and always filling water. Mussels for an appetizer in a white wine sauce. Delicious. Used the bread to soak up the sauce. That good. Salmon was delicious and although I usually hate carrots they cooked it in a sauce that made me eat them all (I never eat them). Shrimp feta angel hair was pretty good. You get six but the portion of pasta plus the salad / soup that came with both meals made us both full. Highly recommended

U1Q1LtOtUxjWIt225yX4Mw.text: This review is for Alexi's 3-7PM Happy Hour. Stopped in for a drink after work after a co-worker suggested we try Alexi's.  I am happy to report that the wait staff is quick and friendly, the restaurant looks clean and the food was spot on.    We had an order of the Happy Hour Calamari with Marinara ($5).  The Calamari was some of the best I have had and the Marinara was excellent.  We also tried the combo plate ($5) that came with more Calamari, 2 Shrimp Scampi and tortollini.    2 Cadillac Margaritas later plus 2 Chocolate Martinis for my co-worker ($5)ea and Alexi's Happy Hour proved to be a great place!

NG9io9BhZPoaueaplPURYg.text: Best duck I've had (gran mariner sause) Cesar salad was also very tasty. Great service, came quick!

-ApKoGl7vjHPfEiEWSNE3g.text: Started out with asking for a wine list which our waiter insisted on us telling him what we liked. He came off as if getting a list for us was a bother. We then ordered appetizers, calamari and chicken caesar salad which were mediocre. The chicken on the caesar tasted like teriyaki which seemed odd and the Calamari was just ok. We then waited a very long time to order dinner and when the waiter did return to take our order I asked for the dressing on my salad to be on the side. He came back with, I toss it in the salad. "I don't care I prefer it to be on the side"! I ordered the salmon which was drowning in butter, unpleasant in texture, and served with two small pieces of broccoli and 2 small quarters of potato. My overall experience is that I won't return nor refer Alexi's Grill. They have a long way to go on improving the food as well as the customer service.

bydBsDR42VOsG_x3xZGiTQ.text: Top notch service, great food. Very professional all around. Not many places like this in the valley. Thanks to Brian and the rest of the staff

oVrJy9tOWJozxQglOR_MDw.text: Amazing food & atmosphere & service! Salmon was amazing! Large portions & The prices are excellent! I'll definitely be back! It's a hidden gem! Wish I knew about this place sooner!

AjCpYpgQlSlKTlX3Y7hUYg.text: Thank you Alexi's for taking a large party of rambunctious hungry men at the last second. When 12 of us walked through the door and asked the hostess if we could be seated, she wasn't too sure. As soon as the owner came by he was like, "right away! Of course we can!"  And they did! Within 15-20 mins we had a great table setup outside. Our server was very knowledgeable and quick with bread an water.   We had a great time. The food was pretty good. I liked my Fettuccine Alfredo with Chicken. It may have been a little too thick but I was good with it.   Thanks again!

jL6SPWOpfINs82_eidY9lg.text: Located in the mid-town area, Alexi's has been the go-to place for executive professionals, politicians etc. since it opened in 1994. And most of the same staff is still there...including the chef! That alone speaks volumes.  The menu centers around northern Italian, continental and Mediterranean cuisine. We started with the combo appetizer. Yum yum! No rubbery calamari here! And the shrimp and tortellini were awesome. For entrees, we opted for the salmon and the halibut special. Again - to die for. Perfectly prepared, beautifully presented, moist and melt-in-your-mouth delicious.  The desserts looked incredible, but all we had room for was some spumoni ice cream. I know, I know...but it was a nice change all the same...and refreshing!  Our waiter was great, made sure all was to our liking as well as personable and friendly. We got there a bit early on a Saturday evening, but by the time we left around 7:30pm, the place was packed, and the patio was filling up.  Alexi's is not "trendy" or "industrial chic", and the interior may need some refreshing, but the food is excellent - and a great value. Prices are remarkably reasonable and the portions are healthy.

7x8CpiuZzYu1F-QSNQ4CKA.text: So, I didn't really understand the 5 star reviews after my experience here.  I was trying to find a new place in Downtown Phoenix to eat at and since the reviews were positive, decided to give Alexi's a try.   The restaurant feels dilapidated, to me it did not seem old and charming, just looked as if it needs a serious renovation.  Reservation was Friday at 7 - yet there were maybe three tables seated, and of course they sat us right next to the other people despite an abundance of open tables not right next to someone else.   The food was above average and the prices are very reasonable.  Our waiter was attentive and explained the menu and specials very well.    The antiquated decor will preclude me from returning despite good food at a good price.  Felt like a dinner at my grandmas

eXkMA9nLajy0VWqnR2SXuw.text: Well, I had great expectations for the food here after reading the great reviews.  We were seated very quickly, but our waiter from the start acted as though we were inconveniencing him.  I ordered Scampi, it was slightly overcooked and the tails were burnt to black; the pasta and sauce were very good though; my friend ordered the cod, it was extremely overcooked and she asked for a new piece. Towards the end of our meal, we could hear him whining to his co-workers (this was a very loud conversation as the staff were behind the prep area going to the kitchen) that we were the ones who sent food back to the kitchen.  I, and my friend, will not be going back, and we will make sure to discourage our friends from going. The food was mediocre and the service was unprofessional.

mkMSpyFMMEpS54g8QB6LDw.text: Our company just moved into the building with Alexi's and I was looking forward to trying it.  Ordered the gyro for take-out off the lunch menu.  Got it back to my office after picking it up only to find that it was missing lettuce and tzatziki sauce.  Went back down and had one of the employees tell me right off the bat that they were out of it...I mean what's the point of a gyro without tzatziki sauce, I ask you (I know, first world problems for sure but still very disappointing)?  It was clear that he knew when he gave it to me that they were out (it wasn't like he had to go back into the kitchen and ask).  Why not just tell me?  I was inconvenienced enough by having to come back down and ask about it...Would have been super bent if I'd traveled to pick it up.  He did go back and look around to make sure they didn't have any but it was pretty much like "too bad, so sad" on my lunch.  Probably won't be eating there again or recommending that anyone on our team do so either.

5-o4hFB6Tyjy2Y3M5X_H8Q.text: Excellent catering Micheal catered my wedding reception and it could have not been better On time, food tasted great , the presentation was right on and great service. Every one was loving it Thanks alexi grill

LDLSI2QaWc7tAKDLg7rO2A.text: Excellent food for a fair and reasonable price (so unusual for the Valley). Great service. We started with the meatball and caprice appetizers. Meatballs were pillow soft, sauce is great. Salads were delicious with great homemade dressing and excellent fresh produce. My friend and I enjoyed the grilled halibut with a goat cheese and lemon herb sauce...oh my goodness. I WILL be returning for that dish...it was impeccably prepared and the flavor was multi-faceted. Divine! My husband's vodka tortellini with alfredo, jalepeno and black beans was unexpected and terrific. Four a party of four, with appetizers and two bottles of wine it was $120. A bargain for the type of white glove service and excellent food.  My only criticism would be the slightly dated interior, but the food was so great, I didn't care.  We'll be back!

8-LEG9UqI3zMxYVA7BQFAQ.text: Went for lunch today with my husband.  Loved the amtosphere of the restaurant.  Easy to find and easy to park.  The service was attentive and good.  The iced tea was fresh and cold.    The small bread sticks that they serve you were just okay.  Not to flavorful and nothing to dip in accept plain olive oil.    The salad that came with the meal was large and the dressing good.  I ordered the eggplant parmesean and didn't care for it.  It was like 6 very thinly cut pieces of eggplant dipped in egg and fried.  Gooey texture, eggy taste.  However, the linguini with red sauce that came on the same plate was delicious and I'm not usually a fan of pasta with red sauce- to boring.  My husband ordered the Southwest Chicken Marsala.  It sounded amazing on the menu but didn't look nearly as good as it sounded.  Very little cheese on top and mostly green peppers swimming in a sauce on the chicken.  He drank coffee with his lunch.  The bill was $25 with tax.  I thought that was very reasonable for a nice lunch.  If I ever go back I will try something else on the menu.

QUQRaNfo-HOveM-TPtyjHA.text: Fun place to visit each time in Phoenix. Right on Central Ave . Great Happy Hour food and drink. Tina the manager is a love, and our favorite server Thomas is top notch, would never know he was from Philly !! Matt the bartender of 30 years is a complete crackup. Smile from ear to ear, and good luck keeping him silent !! A must visit M-F 3 to 7 or for just dinner.

C3p9U_-Rqu4S7fFUISZ7ig.text: Amazing place! Great food. Super friendly staff. Very accommodating for large groups and real flexible. Highly recommended :)

l4D8UJsgUXoS1oKnmThWOg.text: We visited Alexis Last week for a dinner meal.My whole experience  came such a shocker.We ordered 2 Appetizers and a main Course. Appetizers were poor.Caprese was just pieces of cheese with tomato and basil sprinkled without any taste at all. We hoped for a better Main Course and ordered fettucino Alfredo with added chicken.After having a bite,we realised it has not been cooked and mixed properly.White Sauce was very thin in texture and not even mixed so as to give pasta a taste. We shared our feedback with the server,however to our surprise,the server was very rude,he brought the pasta back and again questioned us "What is wrong with the Pasta? Tone was quite interrogative and we felt completed offended.  he did ask to replace the dish,however with that behavior,we decided not to eat anything else and   asked for the cheque. Server took the pasta out of the bill,but the whole approach was very insulting. We would never visit again and would not recommend to anyone else.

TZ_83a4o4xALQ-hHl1CoqQ.text: What a superb restaurant and staff!  They generously allowed us to make a reservation to stay 2 hours past their close time for a special going-away party for a good friend.  Not to mention the Chicken Marsala Southwest I enjoyed was perfectly cooked and displayed with beautiful ripe vegetables steamed to perfection.  What an amazing ambience outside that facilitated magical connections and conversations that I'll remember for a long time to come.

Mbf8W1qYz-5JCMl9cE-1pw.text: A very classy place and a fantastic meal. Enjoyed a Valentine's Day dinner with a group of friends (6 total). Wait staff and everyone we met from the restaurant were pleasant and professional. Highly recommended!

X4sIyblaMY17SjVpRid-cg.text: Alexi's Grill truly is a gem and a staple in the valley. We live here and this is our go to place for a special occasion or if we just want good, fresh, healthy and reasonably priced meal and don't feel like cooking. We also love their Happy Hour. Its a classy and casual place. The Halibut is incredible. The Filet Mignon is superb. The Lamb Chops are divine. My husband loves their pasta with Clam sauce. We like to dress nice when we go there but we see people dressed very casual as well. The entire staff from the moment you enter makes you feel welcome. The service is prompt.

s7U5EQ_zWwMHs11Ay99I1w.text: Went for lunch and had the Chicken Francese with potatoes and veggies which was amazing! The breadsticks and especially the dressing on the salad was great as well. I would definitely return. Looking forward to trying something else next time. It all looks so good. I didn't pay, but I think lunch was pretty reasonable. The staff is very friendly. We were there when it opened, so no wait to be seated. Wish I would have tried this place sooner.

LVnhDpIU3m44FaVgCJjghg.text: I had a pleasant dining experience at Alexis Grill with food having exquisite flavors.  I had a business meeting and I wanted something close that I could bring my clients to. This restaurant has the name Grill in it, so I was expecting a bar and grill environment. Perhaps not the best food, but I was very happy to find they served dishes of a higher standard .    The environment has a feel of fine dinning and the staff is dresses in manner you do not always find in the area Phoenix.  There are dishes you might find in a Greek restaurant as well.  I recommend Alexis Grill to anyone who would like something better than the same food you find at every chain in town.

GVdDwJ7_f9g1flbubOZZNQ.text: I am surprised that I not eaten there before. The food is very good with reasonable prices. The staff was very friendly and service was spot on. Visited before a concert, no lines, no wait, no hassle.

OZpZodOOuKc5bdBTkI-KwA.text: I'm a foodie with, by some accounts, ridiculously high standards.  With that said, Alexis is one of my favorite restaurants.  The food is EXCELLENT consistently and the prices are reasonable.  I always get the poached salmon (I won't eat salmon anywhere else...plus no one knows how to poach salmon properly like Alexis Chefs.)  I should at some point, try the other awesome dishes, but I just can't bring myself to do it!  Also, I LOVE their soups and salad...they are the best. You can ALWAYS tell when a restaurant has an owner behind it vs. a corporate restaurant with employee managers.  Michael, one of the owners, is incredible!  He truly cares about his business.  His wife Christine works there as well and makes you feel so welcome.  I have quite a few business meetings and I conduct many of them there.  The ambiance is perfect for business at lunch time and dinner is really nice and pleasant.  If I ever have a party, I'm going to have Alexis cater the event because I've seen some of their work and the food looks like works of art.  Next time you want a meal to remember, in a comfortable, pleasant setting with kind owners and stellar wait staff (Tommy and Steve, etc.,) check out Alexis...you will not be sorry.

pgsUVTUF5uyEn2Q599XrLQ.text: We had a fantastic dinner with our relatives from San Luis Obispo.   Tommy our server was the best ever!  The salmon outstanding as was the lamb and filet specials.  Thanks for such a great meal.  It will be a go to place forever!

xA3ojKiR2JILNfrrPxQRYA.text: Hidden gem. Had the duck! Biggest piece I've ever had in a serving. Must order if you come for dinner. Mixed veggies. Cooked carrots, broccoli and potatoes. Delicious. Nice cab sav to top it off. Seriously, I'd highly recommend. Owner and staff are extremely welcoming too. Overhead music was wonderful as well.

yteoLNZ-2isMn9PU9YzE0Q.text: Fantastic meal at Alexi's!  Everything was perfect!  Great food, great staff and a gracious host, Michael!

5yNxX7Gi0H23yEhNHrwyGA.text: Staff is very nice. Service is very good. Our appetizers of calamari and eggplant were the best I've had anywhere honestly. My entree of chicken Marsala was just ok. The prices were good and I would go back for appetizers and the nice staff.

QYBD-7tf19xnZOfk5f34uA.text: This restaurant and service needs to be applauded.  We arrived from Houston on 3/16, tired from airport and driving and 2 hour time change.  I looked up Italian restaurants locally.  Alexi's Grill was not number one, but became so, after reviewing on Yelp and looking at the menu, which included 3-7 happy hour.  Arrived to park in huge lot, outdoor covered seating, lounge seating and dinner seating.  Met at door by Michael Zistatsis, co-owner.  We chose the window seat for two (romantic), as full dinner could be served there.  Happy hour pricing is tremendous-fried calamari for me ($5); my wife had huge blackened caesar salad, again $5; Cadillac Margarita for $5 and wine for $5.  Then dinner-all served by Tom, from behind the bar.  He earned a 30% tip.  Michael came back many times and did visit every table in the lounge at lease twice.  This is a mature crowd; not noisy.  2 TVs are in lounge, but not obvious.  We felt like we were wined and dined..so enjoyed ourselves.  By the way, portions were so large, be had enough for the next night's dinner.   We will be back.  What a great find !!!   Highly recommend.  Outdoor covered seating also.

w8wuYrFpkTOvDkqw2nTTWA.text: The food excellent and service impeccable. Prices were comparable with the chain restrauants but the food was far superior.

ckIVuxNvmkQQ3WyVwd38Ig.text: Lovely surprise. We came here with the express decision to have the "best Caesar salad ". We were impressed with the eggplant appetizer, it was delicious. The Caesar salad has a great deal of oregano which is very interesting. The halibut was divine topped with tomato and a very mild  feta cheese. We would definitely recommend Alexi's

x6WBHoYl8W-BSDUQdow2Iw.text: I LOVE this place.  On-line reservations were made for 4 on a very busy night.  The owner was able to adjust seating so another couple could join us.  I always have the Athenian Halibut (not on menu but available on request).  The chocolate mousse is wonderful and although I'm not a mustard fan...the house salad is wonderful so don't let the salad dressing sway you.  My husband was very happy with his pork chop, The owners are phenomenal and service is always great!  They also have a fantastic lunch and happy hour.

mm-oBz-UTNu0m_IIRsm1rA.text: A  most delicious dinner. Parking was a breeze (& free,bonus!) & excellent service, as our waiter gave great prompt service. We started with the shrimp appetizers...my dinner partner had the feta shrimp with angel hair pasta, I had the filet mignon. Everything was cooked to perfection.  My only issue was the potatoes but only because I do not like rosemary. This is a constant issue for me because I wish more menus were clear about how food is prepared but,  you live & learn.  I had a reservation for an early dinner so no waiting. Yay! However, the hostess seemed awkward about the seating. But I picked a table she didn't offer & powered thru. The reason I didn't give more stars is 1. The potatoes 2. At one point there was a bug in my lemonade they served me (no apology) 3. The awkwardness of the seating. Going out is an experience as a whole,  which is how I rate. I'll definitely return as the food was delicious.

RPKjSYLsQMUUZMLqnHhWVg.text: It took approximately 15 minutes from the time we were seated to receive water and menus, but from then they were somewhat attentive. I ordered a bloody mary before we started and it was, by far, the worst beverage I have been served in years. It was not drinkable. From there, unfortunately, things remained the same. Two of the meals we received were not described well by the waitstaff and needed to be replaced... of course after the rest of us had finished our dinner. I ordered the Chicken Zanagrelli which sounded excellent but was not executed well. The sauce was flavorful but the chicken was inedible from a consistency and flavor standpoint. When they cleared my plate they asked if I wanted a box to which I replied "no."   The manager on staff that evening came over and apologized profusely for the meals that had been described incorrectly, and asked how the replacement meals were... to which one of the recipients said "pretty good" - now that should have been a clue that they were just being polite - a term like great or excellent would have been what they should have been listening for.    They really did try hard to fix the situation and they have lovely ambiance, but don't think this will be on the return list.

xmApwjb1ECBdWNFzrGx_Kg.text: Went here with friends for a restaurant week decadent celebration.  None of us had been here before. They accommodated my friend who's a vegetarian no problem. Service, food, friendliness was fantastic. What a wonderful time! Will definitely return..

KMTt2_mhoJA72t_CafWp_A.text: I can't tell you how many times we have driven by.... and finally last night we met some friends for dinner. We were seated promptly and graciously. Lovely intimate atmosphere and the aromas from the kitchen smelled wonderful. Service was outstanding from the beginning of dinner until the end. Wait staff in white shirts vests and ties.. sharp looking staff. Water glasses filled immediately ..same with ice tea. Plates cleared promptly but never felt rushed. Good excellent. Veal chop most impressive and so tender. Trout, fettuccine and shrimp feta all beautifully oriented and delicious. Just very impressed overall. Prices were amazingly reasonable. Will definitely return!
